review: Yummmm!!! Red Robin has arrived in South Florida and as a lifelong fan of the burger chain I couldn't be more happy. Having grown up in Cali, where Red Robin restaurants are in abundance, I have enjoyed the food at Red Robin since I was a kid.  My go to burger is the Banzai Burger, which is a hamburger with pineapple, cheese, lettuce, tomato, and teriyaki sauce.  It is messy, but absolutely delicious.  I order it 99.9% of the time.  It is served, like all burgers on the menu, with bottomless steak fries.  The menu also features chicken burgers, chicken fingers, clam strips, wraps, various appetizers, soups, and salads.  In addition to the main dining room, they also have a full-bar section with TVs.  Word on the street is that the chain is set to open a Pembroke Pines location this Summer.  Hopefully, they do well and continue to expand in the area.

so my friend told me about this place opening up 3 weeks ago. him and i made plans to be the first customers since many other places give out a prize thats worth while for waiting to be the first customer... well to start off the owners let us in about 30 mins prior to the official opening since they saw us waiting in the car since about 8am. (dont ask why). we were told by the owners we had free drinks, then someone else told us we could have a free appetizer. so when the bill came, sure we had our free appetizer but not drinks. we told the waitress to speak with the owner and to call him over here. i didnt really like the fact that they never came to the table, but yet again my friend was telling me to just forget abuot it and let it go. for being the first customer and got treated that way i would think twice... the food was good and so was the service.. but like i said. i basically got treated like a regular customer but just got a free meal like if i had a problem with a meal since places will discount a meal if your not satisfied.. it was the grand opening so they are supposed to give the best customer service to customers and if that was the best, then i have to say. i dont want to see their customer service in a couple of months... oh and even tho they have bottomless steakfries. id idnt like them. but the burger was awesome

Came for dinner on a Thursday around 7:30pm and the place was packed didn't realized they had just opened on Monday. The wait was suppose to be an hour according to the hostess but it ended up being much less, thankfully we stuck around to wait. They have a system that you give them your phone number and they text you when it your turn to be seated. Great that they are keeping up with technology.  Okay the food! I ordered the Blue burger with bottomless sweet potato fries and the freckled lemonade. My burger was juicy and it was a big burger the sweet potato fries were not the best but they were fresh I personally like them crispier. Now the best thing was the endless refills on the freckled lemonade I even love the name. It was minute made lemonade with strawberries and it was really refreshing.  There was a huge amount of employees working that day so we were attended quickly. Our waitress had the refill coming without us having to act like we were chocking. Overall I was happy with the service and food and hopefully it remains that way. Will be back soon. I hope Red Robins opens another new location in the Miami.

We visited for lunch, so there was no wait.  I have been to Red Robin in Cali, so I knew what to expect.  I had the Whiskey River burger, which came with cheddar, onion strings, and bbq sauce.  I added grilled pineapple, which worked.  The burger was ok, but the onion strings were too greasy, and the burger itself was pretty ho-hum. The overall consensus at the table was that Red Robin is just okay.  Burgers are around $10 with bottomless steak fries (which are better than ok).   I guess it's nice to have one in the area, so when their commercials come on TV,  you don't have to feel left out.  There are definitely better burgers to be had in Miami, but if you are comparing this place to casual chain restaurants, Red Robin is one of the better ones.  I might stop in again if I'm in the neighborhood, but it's not somewhere I would travel out of my way for.

Not quite as good as I remember when I went to Red Robin in Texas...but I've got to give them credit for having good service and being very accommodating. I showed up with a friend and we got a table for 4 because we had two other friends coming and we got our table in less time than the estimated wait time (maybe its just me...but it seemed like less time) even though there was a huge group of people waiting outside. After being seated at our table for 4 we found out that 2 more friends were coming and our table would not accommodate 6 people. We spoke to one of the managers and he informed us that he had two parties of 6 that had been waiting for over an hour that they were just seating...so it might be tough. He told us "come and find me when the rest of your group gets here". So we did and he managed to clear a larger table for us and move us over without any extra wait. I thought that was very nice of him. As for the food...it's not that it was bad...but it just wasn't as good as I remember. It could be because they just opened and they are working the kinks out of the system...but I wasn't "wow-ed". I do recommend asking for garlic fries instead of the regular fries...they are pretty darn good. I didn't see them on the menu...but they will give them to you if you ask (at no additional charge...but don't quote me on that)

I love Red Robin and was really excited that we were getting one so close to home. I concede that this rating may not be very fair, since we did go on opening day.  But, it is what it is. We arrived pretty early, around 4:30. So the madness had not started and the restaurant was only about 1/4 full. There were TONS of employees milling around. All were smiling and friendly.  Service, however, was extremely slow.  We didn't leave til after 6:30 and by that time, they were on a wait. Our server was nice, all smiles but inexperienced. I don't think she's waited on a table in her life. Which is all well and good, but she should have had an experienced server assisting. Especially on opening day. We would sit waiting for stuff, including her taking our payment. My husbands burger came out first. Five minutes later, I flag her down and ask about mine. When it arrives, my cheese is no longer melted. Bottomless fries? Not quite. We did ask for a refill but she forgot.  Also had to beg for drink refills. When I asked if it was Happy Hour, she said that it was. Yet we did not get happy hour pricing on apps & drinks. Are not all locations the same in regards to Happy Hour? I wonder. Now the food is still good. No denying that. The freckle lemonade, my favorite, was disappointing though. Tasted like water with strawberries. I'll give it a couple of months and then try again.

We got there on a Saturday afternoon and right away were very pleased with their waiting list method, they use an iPad which takes your name and number and texts you when your table is ready, which means you can walk around the mall or anywhere nearby. Once your table is ready they sit you right away. We tried the burgers which were delicious with bottomless fries, or you can switch them free of charge for a side salad, carrots, or other choices. Their drinks were a really good price too, lots of different choices. Their dessert portions are very generous. We were very happy with our visit and will return for sure.

I have been to Red Robins all over the US enough times to try every burger on the menu multiple times (I guess I should move onto other items and diversify...but then again, why mess with a good thing?)  I've never had a bad experience with my food, service or cleanliness. Everything has been consistently great and this Miami location is seemingly no different.  My waiter was attentive even though it was crazy busy since I went on the first Saturday it was open to the public.  He got all the items right and they came pretty fast considering how crowded the restaurant was. SO excited I don't have to drive to Fort Myers now to get my Red Robin fix! Yummmmmmmmmmmm

Been waiting for this place to open for the past 5 months.... They did not disappoint. I was able to make it out to the sneak peak twice and then was there at 11:15am the day they opened to the public. My burger was perfectly grilled and tasted perfect. The burger isn't the largest of burgers but then again I tried to Monster (dbl patty) and it was actually to much. I'll stick with a single and just double up on fries.   The menu has some really great items but I highly recommend the burgers.  The freckled lemonade is off the chain too!

We came in on the 4th day it was open and were impressed with the fast and efficient service.  Our waitress, a tiny little lady named Marivet, was Amazing!  She was sweet and fast and was highly apologetic the one time that she took more than a few minutes to get us something.  The burgers were perfectly cooked and I thought quite large so I am surprised at some comments that the burgers were too small.  Maybe it's because I always order medium rare so the burger wasn't cooked until all the juices were gone?  I dont know, I just know that they were wonderful.  The bottomless fries and sweet potato fries were also awesome and my daughters said the mint chocolate chip shake was equally good.  All in all, it was a great experience that I hope to duplicate very soon!

Honestly it was nuts. The burgers were a little greasy but packed with cheese dressing all the goodies, endless fries, and I ordered a freckled lemonade"light". Yeah.. well....  The girl at the front told us 15-20 minutes but it took maybe 4 minutes and they take your cell number so they call you when the hostess is ready to seat you. The  lemonade was mixed with strawberry syrup and free refills(5.00).. my glass was chipped so the waiter brought me a new one and was very apologetic ... It took a really long time to get our burgers. I ordered a cheeseburger and my husband got peppercorn burger w bacon. His was very rich and mine was ok... The biggest complaint here was the wait and the noise. Its SUPER loud. other than that it was ok. Our meal came to 27.oo for two and I didn't feel it was worth it. Maybe if I ever go back I would get a salad. They looked good

Had the Royal Red Robin, OMG! Sooo good I was having a foodgasm! Onion tower is a must try. I couldn't eat anything else after that. Although the place was packed they got us in there is a timely manner. Service was excellent and the food was fabulous! Will definitely return.

The hype has a base of reality!  I was visiting some friends down south and had the chance to check out RR today. To be "that guy" I went for their teriyaki chicken burger (instead if the regular burgers they're known for). Size of the bread and chicken piece was pretty fair for the price, and the pineapple, teriyaki and cheese gave a good kick to the lean chicken breast.  My dessert of apple pie bites - basically apple pie nuggets - were hot, crunchy and filled with sweet apple filling. The caramel sauce was a nice extra bit of sugar. The endless raspberry lemonade was good, refills were on point, and the strawberries filling the drink tasted pretty fresh. Debra my waitress at the bar was pleasant and pretty attentive, recommending desserts without being pushy and going to get extra BBQ sauce for me when the busses overlooked it. She also told me they're planning to open a location later this summer by Pembroke Pines, closer to my neck of the woods. My only complaint is that the sweet potato fries could have been a little crisper. I couldn't taste a difference of "sweet potato  taste". I'm guessing maybe it was the same cooking oil. I also saw here on "quick tips" about the loyalty card which wasn't mentioned to me. Decor is a fusion between sports bar and bistro, with TV's by the bar and retro wine and food posters. In conclusion, I can say I believe the hype and glad I have a spot down south to eat.

This place is new. REALLY new and because of that everyone wants to try it. The wait lately has been ranging about 30-45 minutes, but for me it is worth it! They take cell phone numbers at the hostess stand so you get a text confirming you are on the wait list and a text when your table is ready. This allows you to walk around The Falls if the wait is a bit long. The atmosphere and decor are great! Lots of TV's for sports and really casual and laid back. The menu is absolutely delicious. One of their best features is "bottomless drinks" and "bottomless fries". My boyfriend ate an extra basket of fries at no additional cost. (Great when you are feeding a group of hungry kids or men!!!) My Royal Red Robin burger was DELICIOUS. I love burgers with a fried egg on top.  The only down side was that since this place is still so new they are trying to get their shipments coordinated. They were out of a few appetizers and a few desserts, but I'm sure that issue will resolve itself in the upcoming weeks. I must admit the service was phenomenal. Everyone was very attentive, happy and courteous. I know that I will probably be visiting again soon, probably this week! Reeeeeeed Robin... YUM!

First Red Robin we've been to and this is our third visit in a week. :). The burgers are great and cooked perfectly. I like the bottomless steak fries and the menu has a lot of variety.  It's very busy and thr servers are sometimes overwhelmed.  Empty tables are turned over so fast the servers have no time to breathe.  Lots of managers and trainers around to do a lot of service recovery- worrisome that it's so needed, but they do a great job. There's been something wrong w our order each time we've come, but seeing how busy they are, it's to be expected. Perhaps more servers are necessary here until the hype subsides. We'll definitely be back though. :). Glad you're here, Red Robin!

We went to try this place, since it is new.  We went for lunch at an off-hour and were seated right away.  They've remodeled the place since taking it over and opened it up, giving it a more open and airy feeling.  I can see where it might get noisy when it's busy.  The bathrooms were clean. There is an extensive menu with a variety of burgers, soups, salads, wraps and other sandwiches to choose from.  We ordered the grilled chicken sandwich because it was one of the few lower-fat options on the menu.  Many of the menu items look very tasty but have a lot of calories, sodium and fat; so you have to be selective if you are watching your weight and cholesterol.  The grilled chicken sandwich was good, what you would expect from a grilled chicken sandwich. The service was excellent; the waiter was very attentive and brought things right away.  The manager came around to check if everything was ok.      I looked at what other diners were having and the burgers and onion rings were very popular, as were the shakes and the freckled lemonade.  They also have a bar and serve alcoholic drinks. Pretty good for an upscale burger place.

I am doing a follow up review. My first time here at this location I gave RR 3 stars but after the way my second visit went I'm bumping them up to four.  The food was the same but the service was amazing. We had ordered a Queso dip app & a few minutes later a manager passed by to apologize because they had run out. We ordered something else to replace it free of charge. That is customer service! Our server, Jonathan, was on point with drink refills & passed by the table often enough just to let us know he was around if we needed anything without being overbearing. To our surprise, the queso dip arrived as the manager made it his mission to keep us happy & satisfied. The place is still new, so the staff is really trying hard to make a first/second impression on its guests. I am genuinely hoping the level of service stays at this level so RR has a long & succesful residency at The Falls. I uploaded a bunch more photos from my second visit so be sure to check them out.

Brand new place, always super crowded, but never have to wait for a table.  Wait staff is super friendly (Tyler!), and happy hour is a really good deal.  The food is fairly priced, tastes good and they give you a LOT of it, but boy, is it greasy.  Stomach-ache central.

Excellent portions, great taste and not a long wait, even with a huge crowd outside on arrival to the place.  Definitely loved the texting you when your table is ready so you don't have to hang outside the restaurant.  You could walk over to the mall and head right over when they called you.

Red robin is on the same level of burger king or McDonald's.  Actually fast food is better and the service at red robin is so much more frustrating then the food. Stay away and eat a big Mac you will much more enjoy it.

It's definitely worth a trip-- but it is not worth a wait time of over an hour. We went on a Saturday and that was what we got treated to.  The food was good. My kids each tried different things from the kids menu-- Chick on a Stick, Burger, and Corn Dog and they inhaled their food. They also chugged down a couple cups of Bottomless Chocolate Milk. I ordered the Burnin Love and my boyfriend ordered the Royal Red Robin. I liked mine a lot-- it was spicy but not unpleasantly so. The steak fries were very yummy. The Royal Red was just ok. I don't understand the point of a fried egg on a burger if it's overcooked and there's no runny yolk dripping everywhere. The egg was cooked all the way through and that was disappointing. The Freckled Lemonade was delicious.  The Mountain High Mud Pie was a bit challenging to eat-- ice cream but it was frozen to the core. But it was quite tasty.  The vibe is more like a Friday's than a fast food place. It was SO loud in there, honestly too loud. We could hardly talk to each other at our table. People were screaming everywhere. It was a little crazy-making.  So yes, do put it on your list of things to do but wait a few months. It's not worth the insanity.

3.5 stars from me. I wasn't blown away but I wasn't disappointed either. Just your typical burger joint. Good place to go with family/kids. Onion rings were pretty good. I had the mushroom burger with Swiss cheese and fries on the side. I sprinkled a little of the red robin seasoning sitting on the table on my burger for a little extra. Be ware with the seasoning a little too many sprinkles and you may actually ruin your food. Service was good they assigned  2 waitresses to our party (we were a party of 12). I thought that was helpful and it speed up the process. Drink order took a little bit to get to our table however the waitresses did make efforts to accommodate every possible need (specially with the young ones). Prices are  reasonable. Next time I want to try the hummus platter appetizer , didn't get to do that this time :( .  While I was eating I kept busy by looking at all the movie wall art and interesting decor. I would come back here if I am in the neighborhood. Best part about this place in location, right next to the falls. So you can walk off all that food wile doing a little shopping!!!

YUM!  Tasty, tasty burgers and delicious french fries.  Next time I will get that tower of onion rings I saw go by my table all evening. The place is beautiful, and the walls are full of all kinds of random stuff.  My wife's burger was a bit undercooked but not enough to make an issue out of it. The sweet potato fries are not to be missed and the prime rib dip sandwich is great if you like a nice salty jus in which to submerge it. (maybe powdered jus but still pretty good) This place is in the Falls. The Falls is famous for crowds and traffic, so take a little extra time and be ready to wait patiently. The hostess will take your phone number and you will be texted as soon as your table is ready! I liked that, it was convenient.   Give it a shot. it's not "just fast food".

it was a movie night for myself and my boyfriend on a Saturday. We wanted to try Ruby Tuesday as it opened a few months ago and we did not have the opportunity to dine there before but always saw a big crowd waiting for their turn.  After we got our tickets for a 9:45 movie and it was around 7:15 p.m. we had enough time to eat and see the movie. Once we entered the restaurant, we found out that for a table for 2 could take 30 minutes. However, before we found out the time, I already was worries as I saw the tremendous amount of people outside waiting and talked to a lady that had a party of 6 who was waiting exactly one hour for her table. I told my boyfriend, I am not waiting 45 minutes to an hour for a table rather go to another establishment in the mail.  Luckily, we got our table in the right amount of time. Our waitress was really nice and was aware that we were in a hurry to get our food and drinks as we needed to be back at the theatre. I had the lemonade and my boyfriend had a Sprite. I ordered the Grilled Chicken Sandwich which comprised of a tender grilled chicken breast with lettuce, tomatoes, pickles and onions served on the side and a side order of French Fries. My boyfriend ordered the Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger which had Garnished with crisp lettuce, fresh tomatoes, pickles, onions, mayo & Red's pickle relish with American Cheese. It took about 10 minutes for our food to come. His cheeseburger was great. But I only got only the grilled chicken and bun only and not the other ingredients that the sandwiched contained. I informed the waitress and immediately she served me the rest of the ingredients. I found my grilled chicken burger too plain but I guess it is my fault. I did not order it with cheese or did not put any mustard, ketchup, or anything on it; just the lettuce, tomatoes, and raw onions. It was just ok. I did not want to order a beef burger b/c I already had one in the afternoon with my mom at another establishment. Oh well, but DEFINITELY got to give the kudos for the FRIES. They were hot, tasty and scrumptious. I ate them all. OMG! They were awesome which compensated my meal from the bland chicken burger.  I would like to go back again and definitely with more ample time before a movie. I a great experience anyways!!
Completely disappointed. Red Robin is on the same level as mcdonalds! Go eat a "big and nasty" from mcdonalds and pay half the price and get your food much faster.
The food was amazing! Everything was well made including the decor. I would definetly come back with friends or family! The service was very kind and always willing to help the customer.

My first impression of Red Robin was hip, and different. It was a 20 minute wait, so i thought it had to be amazing. Finally when we sat down at our table, the waiter spontaneously starts talking about the table he just waited on, complaining on how their food was bad and cold. Not a good first impression on his part. The milkshakes  were the only decent thing. After waiting another half hour, we got our burgers. The meat was cold and tasted like burger king, except burger king isn't 8.99 a sandwich. All in all my experience was rather sickening. Never going back.

Good Burger but Terrible Service!  I agree in the "Red Robin....yummmmmm!" slogan, but the slogan should be this particular location, "Red Robin....uggghhhhhhh!" I love Red Robin, don't get me wrong with the three stars, but when this location opened they were just not trained properly nor prepared to open! I have been to Red Robins in other states so I have other Red Robins to compare to. I love the food and the service always is pretty good, but this particular location has terrible service while at least the food is consistent in flavor when compared to the other Red Robins.  We went for lunch on Saturday afternoon and the wait was an hour for a party of two. Okay it's Miami and its Saturday so this was expected. We were hungry and we didn't to wait so we found two vacant spots at the bar. It took at least 20 minutes for any of the waiters or bar tenders to even acknowledge we were there and when they acknowledged us, the bartender said "Hi, we are a bit busy so could you give us a couple of I minutes." We must have waited another 10 minutes and the waiter hadn't even taken our drink orders! After 30 minutes of what is supposed to be a faster service at the bar, we got frustrated and spoke with the hostess. They sat us at a table and at least our waitress at the table was pleasant and attentive. We ordered a pick two appetizers, onion rings and the fried mushrooms, which were as expected good. We ordered two burgers which were tasty as well. We asked the waitress for a milkshake go.  The runner (person who delivers food) brought our milkshake but in a glass cup thinking it was to drink in the restaurant. We told the girl that the milkshake was to go, so she went to the bar, grabbed a styrofoam cup and transferred the milkshake from the glass cup to the styrofoam cup. So now, the whip cream was on the bottom of the milkshake and the cup was only half full!  We called the manager and told him if he would sell the milkshake (we showed him how our shake was given to us) to a patron and he said "no, this is unacceptable." He ended up taking the shake off our bill and didn't even swap it out with a fresh one.  Overall, the food is good for a relatively cheap burger restaurant but if you want to have a pleasant experience, please save your time and go accross the street to Outback and I promise it'll be a whole lot better!

This was our first time at a Red Robin. The wait was not too bad, 30 minutes during lunch time. However our server was awful. He seemed upset that we were there to be customers. He looked away when speaking and didn't do a good job of refilling drinks or asking us how the food was.Because they advertise as gourmet burgers and hype them up, I was expecting a great, amazing, one of a kind burger. The burger was okay. I've had better. There was not a lot of BBQ sauce on it which made it dry, however our server went AWOL and I couldn't ask for a side of sauce. the fries were okay, just average steak fries. Flanigan's has better burgers, Cheesecake Factory has better burgers, there are plenty of other places with better and bigger burgers for the same price. There is no need for us to go back there. Save your time and money and head somewhere else.

I'm a huge fan of Red Robin! Finally one in Miami! I came with my boyfriend & best friend 2 weeks after they first opened. I was surprised! The place is HUGE! When we got there it was like a 45 minute wait, so we sat at the bar instead! (I actually prefer sitting at the bar, wink!) Any who, the bartender was great, helped us out with drinks and was really friendly. They had Happy Hour at 9pm to close! So that was just perfect! Had a few drinks and amazing burgers!  I highly recommend getting the sweet potato fries! AMAZING! Will be coming again!

I went back to give it a second chance in hopes to give them a better review. Well, it turned out it got worse since the last time I came!!  Jonathan P was our server. He took our order and we never saw him again until it was time to give us our check. Disappeared! He didn't even bring us napkins nor did he come to ask us how our food was.... and it was bad!! I ordered the Royal Red Robin burger, well done, with the egg cooked medium (so it can be slightly runny). The egg came over hard and tasted like rubber.  My mom ordered the Petit blue cheese burger with no chipotle mayo since she hates spicy and her burger came with EXTRA chipotle mayo. It was covered in it! Moreover, when we got the bill we noticed that if you order a Petit burger, you only get $1 off!! LMAO. Really? The burger was half the size of the normal ones and yet you're only taking $1 off?!  Wow...that's definitely something the menu needs to state or the servers need to tell people when they want to order that.  The manager, the entire time, was eating two tables from us while his employees often came up to him to ask him questions. It seemed so unprofessional!  And while my server was absent from our table the entire time we ate, he was in the back by the kitchen chatting it up with his coworkers (I saw him the entire time). Remind you, he didn't even bring us our food. It was another guy.  Ridiculous and unpleasant experience. Never coming back here again.
My family and I have eaten here about 3 times now and I must say that the service and management have been outstanding. The food is very good too. We will definitely continue to dine there.

Very glad we came and tried Red Robin for lunch. I've read some of the reviews about people visiting for lunch or dinner on the weekends...and it seems like it is packed and people have had to wait a really long time for food/service. That's unfortunate. I went once during the week with 8 other coworkers...the hostess put our tables together promptly when we walked in and 2 waitresses came to get our drink/appetizer orders. They soon came to get our entrees. Although the burgers may have taken 15-20 minutes for our table, I think that's reasonable. I loved my Cantina-Jack Style Tavern Double with Bottomless Sweet Potato Fries. It was only $7.99! And I paid about a $1 more to switch the Regular Steak Fries to Sweet Potato.  I really liked my burger and can't wait to go back for lunch soon! Others in my party thought their burgers were just okay...nothing to rave about, while others really enjoyed their dishes and thought the price was great and portions were good. 3.5 stars from me...until I get to sample more of the menu!

We went to see how the place was a week after it opened. Was an hour and a half wait. The server disappeared after taking our order. We had to send back a cheese Burger twice for them to get it right. Since the server disappeared it was the manager who was the one to take back the burger twice. He apologized and said we wouldn't have to pay for the burger. Our server then finally appeared to place the check on the table and quickly left. The burger was not removed from the check and after waiting 15 minutes for someone to come by the table we just payed the check and left. Only reason I gave it two stars instead of one is because they send a text message to you when your table is ready. I would like to see more restaurants using technology this way.

tried this place for the first time today, the food was great!. I like the choices they had on the menu. They have a kids menu which is a plus for a parent. The fries were really good and I had one of their burgers which was really good. Will defintely go back and take the kids

I go here alot, maybe toooo much!  (I work across the street, okay!)  First of all, technology is put to use in a really cool way. Hostesses walk around with Tablets and grab your info and they text you when your food is ready.  Secondly, out of all the times I've eaten here I've never ever had bad service. For the most part, all the servers are pretty young but the service is pretty impeccable here. They got my order wrong one time and they gave me two burgers in compensation lol.  Thirdly, they have a pretty decent Happ Hour. Beers are cheap, Wine is cheap, drinking is cheap and you're drunk pretty fast on a small budget. I always enjoy sitting at the bar with my coworkers and the environment and atmosphere is always so lively and casual. You'll end up talking to the neighbor to the left or right of you in no time.  Fourthly, you can adjust the menu however you like.  For example, next time try getting the Garlic Fries with your burger, they are AMAZING! (Sweet Potatoe Fries are always my usual go-to as well)  and if you're like me, someone who doesn't eat alot, you can order your burgers "Petite" size. Small burgers and a little bit cheaper.

Great place to bring the kids or just to come hang out with friends for a bit.  The place looks impressive. The waitresses have all been really friendly and quirky. I've always had good service at Red Robin. Some waitresses might be too much for some people. This one girl one time was really snarky and sarcastic. People thought she was rude, I found her hilarious. *Kanye shrug* Some people just take their existence too seriously. Their food however, mediocre at best. Their burgers, which is essentially their star items, are greasy, the buns always soggy and they fall apart. They hit the spot, but not for the price. Especially considering that their sides don't compensate for the price. Their fries are shit. However, the sweet potato fries are YUM, but they cost like $1.50 extra. It's too damn much! I'm already spending fifteen dollars on your damn burger. WHAT MORE DO YOU WANT, RED ROBIN? During Happy Hour, their drinks are well priced though. $2.50 beers and the most delicious house wine I've tried in a while actually.  Overall, Red Robbin (YUUUUUM) is a great place for cheap drank and appetizers during Happy Hour! Dasssseeeet.

This place sucks, a lot.  Okay, I thought I would give it a chance so I went twice and the second time made me realize even more that I really don't like this place at all. The food is atrocious, I mean I didn't know a burger could be made so badly. Both times I went, my food was lukewarm at best and lacked flavor.  Pros: Great location, good service, private lot, decent pricing, decent waiting time, average noise, and nice as well as modern decor. cons: undercooked food that is ill pre-prepared and lacks taste. Although both waitresses were nice, I could tell they didn't exactly know what was going on. One of my waitresses didn't know the definition of medium-rare when it came to burgers: this place has potential but bad food is something I just cannot get over.

If Dennys married Steak N Shake, their spawn would be the Red Robin Diner...if there's any way that statement can be construed as positive, it wasn't meant to be. In our quest to identify the best veggie burger in town, we had lunch here.  We needn't have bothered! First, the service was appalling.  There were plenty of empty tables, and several servers, but our waitress (a dark haired girl who identified herself as being from Rhode Island) seemed preoccupied, and not particularly interested  earning in her 20%.  While we died of thirst, she spent at least 10 minutes standing at a nearby table discussing The Heat.  We finally flagged down another server, who managed to bring us one drink for the whole table.  We shared.  When the check came, the Red Robin "how did we do?" ticket was missing...I guess she knew. The food itself wasn't stellar.  Yes, they give you "all you can eat" french fries but they are only slightly better than Ore Ida.  The veggie burger was really bready...a giant stale bun with a tasteless patty.  When I asked my dining companions about their meat burgers, they said, "meh."  Actually, one did point to the television that was playing a Checkers ad and say, "See that  juicy burger for $1.99?  Now I feel stupid."  Ours were at least $8 each. The decor is pretty dismal, 80's earth tones and wood veneer.  I wanted to like this place, but given that only a short walk from Johnny Rockets and a short drive from Fuddruckers, I can't envision returning.

Ok, this is the last place I would expect to visit (a vegetarian in a burger joint?!).  But, someone gave my father a gift card so I went with him.  I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised.  I thought it was a fast-food place, but it is NOT.  It's a regular sit-down-and-be-served restaurant.  It was loud in there, because in addition to playing music, it was very busy and there was a lot of talking going on.  It is not a quiet place. There is mostly fried stuff and a million different burgers.  But, there was also a big array of salads and wraps.  The menu is extensive, so you don't have to eat anything unhealthy if you don't want to.  Tho, I would imagine if you ate here every few days, you would weigh 600 pounds!  The menu in the restaurant is much bigger than the one I looked at online. Our server was fantastic; a friendly and very nice guy named Tyler.  He explained everything and was really great.  I noticed that most of the servers are young, energetic kids; I like that. It is a burger joint, for sure.  But, I liked the fact that any meat burger can be substituted for a vegan Boca burger or another type of veggie burger - as a vegetarian, that's great for me. I had the vegan Boca burger and substituted regular fries for sweet potato fries.  It was delicious.  Fresh, soft bun and a gigantor Boca burger.  The sweet potato fries were great.  My one complaint is, the Boca burger was not grilled (it was cooked, just not grilled - to clarify).  So, it came out kind of brownish-looking. It wasn't as appealing as a burger on a grill, and it had no crispness to it.  But, it still tasted good.  It was like it was nuked rather than grilled.  That is just an aesthetics complaint, tho. My father had the "burning" burger, or something like that - some burger that sets your mouth on fire with jalapeno peppers.  He ordered it medium rare and it came out perfect for him.  He said it was delicious.  My mother had a crispy chicken sandwich which she loved - she had coleslaw that was very good. I liked the decor of the place, and it is very clean and lots of space.  There are tons of booths and tables.  We were too full to try any desserts. The prices are probably what you would expect.  The average meal (burger with all the fixins and a side of fries) averaged around $9.  There are plenty of sides that you can substitute the fries for. I can't believe I am giving it 4 stars; but, my experience, despite apprehension, was enjoyable!  I'm a fan.

Who ever decided we need ANOTHER chain restaurant was wrong. I want to like it, don't get me wrong. I've been there several times and the food is tasteless and  further reminds me that I'm at a chain. Boring - Red Robin...please impress me with your affordable family watering hole?? Please. Oh, and I would start by firing your 12 year old servers with entitlement issues.

Waited 45 min. Just to sit next to a party of 15 middle school girls screaming at each other most of the time,yes it's a kids hangout and will be loud . The service was ok by a young man in his early 20s and very energetic. For some strange reason the coke I ordered was flat and tasted like root beer,at first I thought it was a mistake and made the server bring me another 3 more times until he finally confessed the soda machine was broken. We ordered the French fries appetizer and were very impressed with the presentation and taste. The burgers we ordered where ok and really nothing to rave about but I will say that the onion rings might be worth another trip .

We got here around 7 pm on a Friday night and only had a 10-minute wait.  That was rad.  The burger with fried egg and sweet potato fries were delicious and cooked perfectly, and the service was flawless.  Can't wait to come back.

This was a place i had high hopes for that disappointed greatly. My little brother wanted to have his 15th birthday here, so sure enough a party of 10 of us arrived eager to experience some "yummmmm". We called ahead and learned that they don't take reservations and were looking at an hour wait. No problem, it's the birthday boys choice! What was a problem was the fact that for an hour and a half we waited with no check in from a manager or the hostesses. We had to check in 3 times and never once got a "just a little longer" or "would you like me to send some appetizers over?" I work at a restaurant and was absolutely livid at the lack of attention a group of 10 that was about to drop a lot of money got. Had we not been so hungry and eager to give the birthday boy a good night, we would have left way sooner, but alas. After basically begging for a table (nearly 1:45 min wait) we sat in a very bad mood. the saving grace was our waiter (i think his name was Colby? He's from N. Carolina)  He absolutely saved the night, the perfect definition of a good waiter. All the orders were correct, things came out as timely as they could, and everything was relatively tasty. My veggie burger was pretty acceptable, and the fried zucchini is really nice, though the fries are pretty lackluster and appetizers are fried to hell. Honestly, we were so hungry at that point anything would've hit the spot.  Won't be going back anytime soon. Food wasn't exceptional (better burgers can be found all over Miami) and lack of service (besides Colby) was unforgivable.

Diet Coke was expired.  Turkey burger had no taste & under cooked.  Smoothies are not real smoothies.  Just lots of ice and syrup.  Very disappointing.  Couldn't taste shakes because the machine was broken.  Save your money and go to Fuddruckers.

Red Robin..Ehhh... I really wanted to like Red Robin. I really, really did. My husband and I came by on a Saturday afternoon, and didn't have too much of a wait. He ordered a burger and I got a chicken sandwich. I had to send my sandwich back because it came out on the wrong kind of bread, and there was some sort of sauce on it. Once I got what I had ordered, it was just a regular chicken sandwich. Probably the healthiest thing on their menu (look up their nutritional info online...SCARY STUFF!). My husbands burger was just ok. I took a bite and it was definitely just a big greasy mess with very little flavor. The fries were pretty good, but this place really isn't worth coming back to.

rrreeedd rrooobinnnn, mehhhhh! The best way to sum my burger anyway.. I enjoyed the service, the fried stuff, the drinks looked great (I just had water though) but the burger I ordered was pretty, well, lame.. I'm not a big fan of frozen pre-made patties I can buy at Publix or Costco. They're ok for cooking up at a party but not in a place that sells "gourmet burgers" I had the sautéed s'hroom buger which sounded good in theory but I'm also no big fan of canned 'shrooms.  Maybe I ordered the wrong thing, maybe the cooks got lazy that day, I just know when I go back I won't be ordering a burger.

I wasnt able to try the full menu since we went late night after a movie. The chips and guacamole was okay and the mud pie was good. Service was excellent. Definitely will go back to try their full menu.

Excited to go and check out Red Robin! Nice atmosphere and different look than other burger joints. Service is good. As far as burger, it's not bad but not the best for the price. Unlimited fries is a nice treat. Overall experience was nice.

My first Red Robbin experience - Wow!!! We got there early (11:30 am) and easily found a table wayyyyy in the back (so as not to disturb anyone else).  First class service and a truly to die for yummy bacon burger (the works) Would love to come back and have a beer with that burger but I suspect that the experience will be completely different.

I have been to many Red Robins. My first one was in Harrisburg PA and I was a regular there. This one is a little different and the setup is far different than I was used to...  I must have been to the best of the red robins in PA because I wasn't impressed by this location. The food was hot but the service was close to non existent. I am pretty sure the bartender had tables in the back or was doing something back near the bathrooms. We only saw her three times and we were sitting near the bar. Some tvs so if you are  into sports you can prob get the bartender to change it to your channel on slow days. Things to try on the menu: BBQ Whisky Ranch Wrap Royale Burger (has an egg on it) Pros -You can order the burgers how you want them cooked. Medium for me. -Freckled Lemonade is like a dessert with real strawberries. -Bottomless french fries. yessir. Cons -If you don't like seasoning on your fries... make sure to ask without.. -Can get very noisy when full.

I had the Bacon Cheese Burger... i dunno, it was all pretty mediocre. I can't say it was a terrible experience but it was nothing to dream about later.  as far as beer on tap, they had the basic stuff...Sam Adams as the clear winner in the bunch which is not saying much (i'm a beer snob) it was all pretty underwhelming.

Even though i am rarely in the mood for a burger, I decided to check this new place out. I did not regret it at all. I went on a late afternoon so the place was pretty empty but the waiter was very friendly and the service was quick. Most importantly the burgers were very good and the fries very very good with honey mustard.
food is fresh and the staff is amazing. make sure you stop in by for happy hour from 8-close Monday through Friday !!

The second best burger I've ever had was at this place. I come here any time I have the chance. which unfortunately has only been like 3 times but one of the waiters always remembers us. The service at this place is 5 star, hands down.
Gluten free buns! I hardly cared what the turkey burger tasted like, (it was OK)

I've been twice now so I feel as though I've gotten a pretty good feel for this burger place.  Here's what's good about Red Robin: The Burgers!  They're fast, fresh, well-seasoned and the menu offers lots of different ways of having them (swiss and mushrooms, BBQ and bacon, etc.)   The "other" options!  I think it's great that a person can choose to have veggies or fruit instead of fries, and that there's a whole wheat  AND a gluten-free bun option.  That you can also order a veggie burger or a turkey burger is great, too.  I had morning star veggie burger on a whole wheat bun last time I was there and it was very satisfying.  This makes it a great place to be a Weight Watchers.  I can have a "burger" and not a lot of guilt. Ok, so here's what's bad: The service.  I don't what it is about Saturday afternoons, but Red Robin is not bringing their A-Team to the field for Saturday's lunch.  We've arrived after the lunch rush, so there's no wait for the table; it's as if our waiter goes off to the hinterlands between taking our order, and returning with the check.  Where was he in between when I wanted more water?  Or when my five year-old decided she needed a booster seat?  Please check on me at least once while I'm eating, preferably a few bites in BEFORE my food gets cold and I decide it's not worth it to send it back. Not family friendly.  I know there are a thousand t.v.'s on the walls.  They are showing sports; that makes Red Robin a sports bar, not a kid place.  But worse, and why Red Robin is only getting three stars from me: last time we were there, the table behind me was being bussed by two kids who were swearing strong enough to blister paint...18 inches from my kids' ears.  That's just not ok.  If you're in the public eye, you need to keep a lid on your drama and on how you choose to express it.   We may yet return to Red Robin, but only if someone in my house begs to go, which I doubt will happen.
This place delivered a solid innovative burger, sweet potato fries and draft at a good price.

My GF and I have been wanting to try the food here since it opened up and finally made it for lunch yesterday. We sat at the bar and had a great time. Food was really good! The margaritas were great but the draft beer selection was limited. Our bartender/waitress was very nice. We'll be back.

Went there on a Saturday night at 8pm - party of 4 (2 kids/2 Adults). It took 30 mins to get seated, however, when we walked towards our table, we saw many empty tables around. No needed to have us waiting this long. We ordered 2 large beer drafts, a burning love burger, a reg cheeseburger and the kids had the pizza and mac 'n cheese. Food took over 25 mins to arrive. The unlimited fries, never happened for us, since they took forever to bring them. When they did, we were done and ready to go. Even though food is good (like any other burger place), what could've been a quick 30 mins dinner, ended up in over 1 hr 45 mins. Too much for a burger place. Would I come back? Maybe ... if i'm close by and have nowhere else to go.
Still good food and great service. Our server was Becka and she was great, quick, kind, and attentive.

I was so excited to finally try Red Robins but I was so disappointed. I went with my cousin to have dinner. The service was good. For starters, we had the onion tower that was delicious! After I had the Prime Chophouse burger that was also delicious. What was disappointing  was about 25 minutes after we left we both got super sick. Definitely not eating here for a while!

Writing this review while sitting in the booth. Ordered a beer that never came. Waited 40 minutes to get served our meal. What a shame. Will never return to this location. This is my first time at this location and my wife's second. My wife tells me that the last time she visited the service was also very slow. I highly recommend you choose from the many other restaurants located near by. I hope this will save you from making a mistake in choosing to eat here.

Don't waste your time if you want to leave in less then 3 hours! Went to the Pembroke Pines location and the staff was rude and slow the managers inattentive and lazy. Brought in a group of people after my daughters build a bear party in the mall you would think knowing we were coming in they might be prepared. Omg nightmare, the servers were completely inept the food was wrong and raw. I even was forced to bus my own table to escape the mounting dirty dishes at one point I was strongly considering getting my own drink refill as well. The manager was completely unprofessional while the waiter was too busy watching the football game to be bothered with our meal. Horrible experience! On the plus side after talking to corporate office I did get a refund. But not worth the stress over a below standard meal.

Meh. It wasn't what I expected, but it was ok. My boyfriend and I popped in on a very recent rainy Saturday night in hopes of not having to wait. When we got there, there weren't mounds of people waiting outside (like we've seen in the past as we've driven by) but there was still a 35 minute wait! We opted to bypass the wait and sit at the bar. The service was very good, waiters were prompt and friendly, but the food was mediocre and not "gourmet" as noted in there tagline. (Sorry but OneBurger has spoiled me, now that's a gourmet burger!) The guacamole appetizer was ok, don't expect a big serving of guacamole, though. The swiss mushroom burger was okay. Overall, just ok.

I am generally not a chain or fast food fan, however my first red Robin experience ever was pretty satisfying and I was impressed that our food was consistently good and served quickly. I love that all of their sandwiches have the option to replace with a BOCA burger so the next time my sister comes to town I know as I can bring her to eat. We had the onion ring tower which were perfectly fried, not greasy and had the right amount of breading. We ordered fish and chips and two burgers and everything was great and who doesn't love endless steak fries. I only ate half of my burger because I wanted to sample a milkshake and opted for the cookies and cream, I would say the milkshakes are good but not the best and the serving size is very normal so makes it a good finish to a somewhat filling meal from a big burger. I think it was nice to have the chance to stop and eat here and if I were in the area, I would eat here again. It is a chain and therefore is missing some of the mom n pop charm we tend to enjoy, so this is why I rated it as a 4 out of five stars.

Good burgers, family friendly. They have a full liquor bar which was a nice touch to this burger joint. Waitress was very attentive and order did not take long. I would have given more stars but a douche bag idiot that was sitting next to us kept on interrupting our lunch w his stupid banter. May try again in the future

What's funny about this place is that I always saw the commercial but I never found a Red Robin in Miami until a while back when I came to the Falls.  I've been coming to Red Robins probably four times and the place has never failed me. I love the size of the burger. I always order the Whiskey River BBQ burger. The burger contains the special BBQ sauce, lettuce, mayo, and under the patty crunchy onions. To drink I always order the very berry raspberry limeade and it is very sweet and delicious for drinking it during the summer but it's good for any time of the season.  I recommend for those who have never ate to Red Robins to come over and try the place. In my opinion, the four times I have went to that place, the service has been good to my family and I including the food.

I think this place is yummmmmm! Lol the freckled lemonade is so good and the burning love was huge and made perfect and the sweet potato fries were my fav I had 3 baskets of them that's my one weakness and that's what will bring me back.

Well I just read ostof the reviews and yes the first times I came here they were noisy . But there is a bar area and the place gets very packed. As for the tv well it's a bar bars play sports . The food was good and the burgers although not a traditional burger our pretty good. You can always order it a la cart. The p,ace does get packed in the weekend with waits but so do many restaurants look. At pf changes and cheesecake factory. And let s see that the place looks and feels cool and the apps and plates are pretty good .service was good, but sometimes yes your forgotten just ask for help . Still food notes not bad and thank god it's not a fast food place .

We chose the restaurant to celebrate our daughter's birthday because of the adult shake menu on their website. Our waitress did not know of its existence or bother to find out about it for us.  We has to ask twice for our grandson's drink be put in a covered child's cup. Our food was sitting at the kitchen window for 15 minuted before it was delivered to our table.  The burgers were greasy and the onion soup was very salty.  The hostess brought balloon's to the kids at the table next to ours, but ignored our grandson.
YUM!!!! Different is good. Gimme avocado on a burger, I'll eat it.  They have different burgers, and great onion rings.

My fourth time eating here.  This place gets very busy on Friday-Sunday.  Can take up to an hour to get seated during peak times. The beef burgers, variety of toppings and tasty sides gives this place 3 stars. The bar service is slow unless Debra is working. All 3 times we were seated, service staff was distracted by social activities. (3 different servers mind you). The Turkey burger was aweful.  Tastes like a fat BK Broiler from Burger King.  Plastic stale turkey patty that leaves a nasty after taste.  Condiments couldnt cover that taste up.  After taxes, its a $10.00 burger that disappoints.  Cheesecake Factory, TGI Fridays and even Johnny Rockets makes a better Turkey Burger. In Miami, we are blessed with a Gourmet Burger Joint revolution...and we have plenty places that offer a $10.00 burger that tastes better. Once you know what a gourmet burger should taste like, disappointment will often follow.

Went here for lunch yesterday with some friends. We were greeted in a friendly manner by the hostess as we walked in and were seated immediately. Our waitress Debra M. was probably the most friendliest and attentive waitress I've had at any restaurant I've been to in a very long time. All of our food came out exactly as we ordered it. We all had a great time there. I will defiantly go back again.
The burger was great but not nearly as amazing as I imagined, I've definitely had better. The service overall experience was good.

Came here the second day they opened after having experienced their food at the location in Gulf Coast Town Center and am glad they came down to S.Fla. Love the burger and chicken sandwich with the grilled pineapple; such great flavor. Have been a couple times and still no qualms.

I asked for medium, got well done. The fries were okay. The burgers were just okay. The food took long to arrive and the place was 1/4 full. The burgers sound better than they actually taste; all burgers are about $10-$12. You can get a much better burger elsewhere, not sure I would go back.
Best whiskey BBQ burger and fries. Great chill spot to have fun with friends and family or chill date night

I love red robin.. The taste, quality, I can go on forever.. I did not like the long wait time between meals though. I felt that they were understaffed on the day we went, which was on the weekend.  It could've been faster and better service. Aside from that, the food was great as always.
Great place. They hamburgers are good. Service was excellent. A good variety of stuff. Enjoyed with the family.

I was impressed! I thought this was similar to a Five Guys but the menu is pretty extensive including items like fish and chips, delicious juicy burgers, appetizers, cocktails... My husband had the Prime Chophouse, loved it, juicy, tasty, hot and fresh. I had the bbq Chicken Sandwich and it was the best Chicken sandwhich ive ever had! The chicken was juicy and tender and I loved the sweet BBQ sauce and crunchy onion strings! My husband loved his "cookie magic" milkshake and I enjoyed my beer as i always do, in a freezing cold mug ; )  The service was good (not amazing), the atmosphere fun and loud.  I am looking forward to coming back and trying a burger!

We just stopped for a quick bite.  The drinks were advertised as mixed with fresh juice, they were not.  The cheeseburger meat tasted like it was rehydrated before it was cooked.  The floor was dangerously greasy.  Service was just average.  Twenty minutes after we left we got ill with gastrointestinal symptoms.  Will definitively not return.

Had a decent dinner at Red Robin tonight. My mom and husband picked two of their signature burgers--the A.I. Peppercorn and the Smoke & Pepper-- and they liked their burgers, although they were a bit overcooked. I had the Crispy Chicken salad and it was okay, as well. Kids menu has several options so that was good!

I am absolutely infuriated with this place. I ate there with my family days before Christmas and 4 out of 6 of us got sick. Even ordering my burger well done, I got the most sick with symptoms of vomit, diarrhea, fever, and headache for a whole week. Yes, I spent Christmas trying to open presents while puking my brains out. After I recovered and went back to demand a refund for the poisoned food I was served, I got the run around from the manager and even their HR department. I'm not one to pursue such a thing but it pissed me off that they called me a liar and even my doctor a liar! They claimed that my food poisoning symptoms were OBVIOUSLY something I caught in the air that was going around. The food wasn't that good anyway and the service was dull and slowwwwwwwww. The restaurant barely had anyone in there and it took like an hour to get our food out. I WOULD NOT recommend Red Robin.

Such a disappointment!!!! It was our first time here and I had a free birthday burger coupon. First off, our waitress was Mandy.  I don't know if  she was having a bad evening but she took our drink orders and didn't come back till the evening manager noticed after sitting so long that we still didn't have any drinks. Finally another waitress took our drink orders again and finally brought them out. I ordered the clam chowder soup, only to be told 10 mins later, by Mandy that they would have to make a fresh soup which would take long so if I wanted to wait I could or change to a different soup so I changed the order to the french onion. Now the soup was delicious so I was happy. When our burgers finally came, my boyfriend had the shroom n swiss and it was dry and like he said,"had no love put into it". I ordered the chili burger and although it was good, it couldve been a lot better. She also forget our sauces we had asked for our fries which was a chipotle which was a disgusting too much mayonaise flavor and a melted cheese sauce which tasted like fake cheese ...yuk!!!! The evening manager was great, he kept coming around (more then our waitress did) making sure we were taken care of along with the rest of the tables in our area. He truly showed great customer service. We've decided although he was great, our waitress and burgers weren't worth coming back and paying $11 a burger. I am sadly disappointed though cause I am a true burger lover . . .I guess we'll stick to other burger joints.
Great atmosphere.  Great service.  Good food.  Watching the game.   The burgers are great.  I had the basic cheeseburger.  The fries come with it and they are bottomless.  Awesome.

Always a good dining experience at Red Robin. Royal Red Robin Burger....YUMMM Love that fried egg in my burger. Tortilla Soup is hearty and cheesy.... YUMMM I want more!!! Can't wait to come back. Our waitress Keri was very nice and informative.

I love coming here. There is never a wait. As soon as you walk in you are seated immediately. The food is great. I recommend you try their new angus burgers. There chili con queso dip is good too. Service is excellent. You are served quickly by polite people and super attentive. Did I mention it's pretty cheap.

This was my 1st time to Red Robin and WOW!!!  I love it!  I had the Banzai burger and was sooo yummy yummy to the tummy.  The staff was friendly and fast.  The place was nice and clean.  I cant wait to come back again.  Too bad they closed the Red Robin at the International Mall.  I live on Miami Beach, so going to this Red Robin is a bit of a drive but well worth it.  RED ROBIN...YUMMM!  :)

The burgers are delicious! Every time I've come it's never failed the please. I also recommend the skinny absolute lemon da guaranteed to lift your spirits! The bacon guac burger is my favorite. Their guacamole is to die for. Must check it out if u haven't been here!!!

If you are in the mood for a delicious burger this is the place!! They're fried are to die for the service is great my server was Gus he was so nice and so good with my 2 girls he always make sure we were good will continue to go here all the time !!!

When I walked in the atmosphere was very nice and the hostess greeted as soon as we entered. We sat in a booth near the bar and a awesome server took care of us the whole time. She was very nice and attentive even gave us red robin loyalty cards . I had the shorty onion ring tower which was awesome the two dipping sauces it came with were amazing ! I couldn't choose which one to dip in. Then I had the bacon cheeseburger with added avocado. I was a little disappointed the burger was good but the patty seem too burn for my liking . Every time I bit into the burger I get a burned taste in my mouth. I only ate about half the burger. I also got the bottomless sweet potatoe fries which were awesome  ! To drink I had the vanilla milkshake , it was awesome and she added rainbow sprinkles on top . Overall great service , awesome onion rings , burgers are okay I hope when I go back I don't have the same burnt patty, and milkshake recommended :)

The food is over portioned and filling for its price. The burgers have good taste but the buns lack for something to be desired. The burgers tend to fall apart so its almost required to get it cut in half every time. Even though the food is fattening, it still very tasteful. The salads are God awful. They are over cooked and oddly portioned. Don't bother ordering it. The staff is slow and to get any real service you must sit at the bar. The desserts are awesome though!
I love this place! The food is great.. Wish there was one In homestead fl... There burgers and fries are so yummy.

We ate there last night for the first time. After seeing the commercials I was curious to see what all this Yumm stuff was about.  The food was ok. Not the best burger and not the worst. The sauce for the steak fries was pretty good. The prices were on par for "gourmet" burger joints in the area... but for quality and service I would choose a Five Guys over this place if I wanted a burger. Advantages this place has would be that it is kid/family friendly and also has a full bar. It's a restaurant that tries to have something for everyone but misses the mark on service.  The operations side is what needs work. When seated our table was cleared off but had oily globs and gummy residue all over it.  We were sat in a mostly empty restaurant that had one large party (10-15 people) and a few booths occupied and it took over 30 minutes just to get someone to take the drink orders (hey, we've been here staring at menus for a half hour, why not just take the complete order and try to make up for lost time?).  The drinks came out but then they never returned to take our meal orders for a while.  I wont get into the details of every little mishap, but we were there for three hours. Three Hours!!

Visited the Falls location with my wife and three kids for a late lunch. Restaurant was clean and welcoming.  Our server (Gus) was very pleasant and helpful, and the service experience was excellent (without it the rating would have been 3 stars). The burgers were better than average, but definitely overpriced. Main complaint was the overall greasiness of the burgers and the almost immediately soggy bottom buns. Had to break out the flatware and plenty of napkins. Onion rings were crisp and well prepared (but a bit greasy too) and the fries were great. Mud pie for dessert was good and chocolaty, but not exceptional. The bill, however, was; including our drinks it came to $120 for five people). We plan on coming back again thanks primarily to the service experience.... And the onion rings! Yummm!

We went to the location at the falls. The first time we visited the service was great and the food was amazing. Every time we have went thereafter we have been disappointed. We came back and have given the place multiple chances because we were hoping that the place would live up to the first time we went. Well, the last time we went the cook dropped my husbands burger and they had to remake it so it took an hour for us to get our food. Today several people who ordered after us received their food first and the manager thought it would solve the problems by giving us more "free fries" which they do anyways. I am not impressed and will not be coming back for a long time. Back to five guys.... Such a shame too.

I expected more from them. The burgers are good but nothing great. It is to expensive for a burger that isn't great. I have it 3 stars because the service was good and the burgers are good.... I just expect more for my money. Fuds...

Service was terrible. Loved the place when they first opened but the food quality and service have really gone down hill. Fries were cold. Asked for a new batch and they came back cold again. Burger didn't come out fresh and I didn't even want to bother to ask for a new one. Best part...I guess they forgot to change the channel after the soccer game because I had the pleasure of watching a chiropractic infomercial for an hour.  Don't think I'm ever coming back here.
The food is always great, but can't rely on the service to be the same each time. Today we have a nice and friendly server. Let's see.....

This was the first time that I have been to Red Robin's, i was told that you would have bottomless fries. When we ordered our food we waited for almost half hour to receive our food. When we finally got our food it was great! But the service was atrocious! We never got extra fries or a refill on our drinks!We didn't receive our refill drinks until we finished eating our food.

i give it a 4 because everyone had a good attitude and the service couldn't be called 'bad' but it was my first time eating there and i felt the quality of my burger could have at lease been presented better.  i know i am taking a chance on taste when i come to a new place but i am always hoping for good presentation ..:(

The hostess got us seated right away. It was not very busy for a Friday evening. Our table of seven was seated and waited way toooooooo long for even a hello and a beverage order. The manager walked by several times and offered no help. Onky when we had food she inquired if we needed anything. The server was very friendly, but took to long to greet us, get beverages, and kept forgetting small item requests. Overall, garden burger was not as good and way too much lettuce for a lettuce wrap. I would go back...but not the normal excellent Red Robin experience.

Here at Red Robin, excellent service and enjoying our food with one exception! My first bite had a flavor that was off! I thought the hamburger bun had margarine on it. I questioned our server and very pleasantly, she said she would find out. When she came back she said that for the last few months Red Robin has been 'buttering' their hamburger buns with something made from cottonseed oil.  A 'butter flavored' cottonseed oil! If you don't like an over-riding margerine flavor with your 'gourmet' burger may I suggest asking the server to ask the kitchen to skip 'buttering' the bun on the burger. Other than that I had a very pleasant visit and conversation with our server and the manager. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because of the affore mentioned 'buttering'.

I'll give this place another try, but our first visit wasn't a great first impression. It may have been our timing- we showed up at 8:50pm, on a night they closed at 10, which we didn't think was too late though. Our table didn't have drink menus. After requesting one, it took 15 minutes before our drink order was taken. Our food then took 20+ minutes to come out. Our appetizer came out after the entrees. We never got refills on our drinks, and our server never checked on us after dropping off the food, until dropping off the bill. The food was good, and they comped us our appetizer since it came out after the food, which made it a little better. We'll give them another try, and see if service is any better this time around.

Excellent! The restaurant is always clean, the staff is always helpful, and the food is always great! I order from the gluten-free menu and the manager always comes out to bring my food and confirm that it was properly made. I love the simple burger with the lettuce wrap and the delicious bottom-less fries! I've also had the salads which are also fresh and delicious. The management team should be proud the they have such a great team in place at The Falls!
Red Robin is great I love the location in the falls it's great best burgers in town and great service

OK, I get it.  I'm about to talk about Red F**king Robin.   Not exactly a foodie destination, but I have some texture behind this.  My 7 year old daughter could choose anywhere for us to go and she chose this.  So what my babies want, my babies get.  Stomach prepared... Let me begin with these two words...  HOLY HELL!!!   If you have not done so, please rent the movie, "Waiting" and you will understand that I just lived through that movie (you will also never want to go to another chain restaurant again). First, we walk in, wait 5 minutes before anyone even acknowledged us (BTW, there was a manager who just came off of a smoke break there the entire time, just never wanted to say "Hi Bastards!  Table of 5 suckers for what's about to amount to a game of Russian Roulette?!?". Finally, she finds enough digits on her hand to count to the #5, correlates that with the amount of menus required, argues with a lazy ass server who is angry that she's working on Sunday and wants to give her shift up anyway and finally gets us to a table.  We didn't know if we should feel proud or disgusted that we were surrounded by a carnage of unbussed tables and trash and we just happen to get the VIP treatment to the one good table in the section...  One side note, they were never cleaned during the entire meal. After way too much damn time to order and then waiting on food (yep, kids were patient, but about to go Chernobyl), we get the slop slung on the table.  Fries?  Cold, Cold, Cold...  Pizza for the kids?  We're at a Red Robin, I know, but can't you just put it in the microwave for another 2 minutes to make warm?   My burger?  Yes, I too have learned the trick that a shitload of condiments does indeed drown the briquette like patty on my bun...  I begged for instant diarrhea after the "Fear Factor-Like Gut Bomb" that I ate a few bites of. It's rare when you have the special experience of God forsaken service, ambiance, food quality, and cleanliness, but WOO HOO!  We hit pay dirt on this one folks! I should thank them and make this 5 stars, because it's official that my family will never take another step into this place again.  I pray that someone from their corporate office reads this and says, "Uh, we don't think we want someone to rate us like this again".   I hate to post such an angry and sensational review, but it simply isn't hard to smile and say welcome, give you halfway speedy service, and serve at least a digestible meal considering, I don't know...  YOU'RE IN THAT BUSINESS.  But it's safe to say they missed the mark this day.

Worst service ever.  After waiting 10 minutes before anyone even realized we were sitting at a table, we were finally asked what drinks we would like. We ordered appetizers which never   the way. Waitress said she would remove the appetizers from the bill, which she did not do. Fries were cold, burger was cold. Horrible service.
Red robin is one of our favorite restaurants! The food is always delicious and you can depend on it. The gourmet burgers really hit the spot. Betty
Sunday, 3pm We were asked to wait 15 and more than half of the restaurant was empty. Wait 13 minutes for a waiter....burgers aware the best...service uhmmmm don't think so
Melt down at Red Robin. Waiting at the table for 1 1/2 hours without food. Service has been declining in over our last visits.

Red robin was absolutely delicious! The prices are extremely fair, and with any burger you purchase, you get unlimited fries. The service was spectacular and very helpful. The ambiance is great, and decoration all round is pleasing to the eyes.

Food was ok, service was terrible! Waitress seemed to be serving our table and bar tending at the same time. Therefore, we had to wait very long to be assisted. Waitress would only tend to us when we called her over, forgot water that we ordered several times. The fries are supposed to be endless right?? Well, what's the point if they take half an hour to bring them over anyway? If it is going to be like this every time I rather not even come here again. You have been warned.

Honestly I can't get enough of this place I'm hooked!  From the chicken bruschetta to a classic cheeseburger they will not disappoint! Everything is beyond clean and the staff is super attentive always making sure everything is okay or if you need anything! If you haven't been to red robins yet, what are you waiting for! It's not expensive and the food is great! P.S ask for Michael hands down the best server in here!!

My boyfriend had always wanted to try Red Robin, so we stopped in after Christmas shopping last night. So sorry we did! While the waitress was really, really nice, we had extreme issues with our visit.  1. the glass of wine I ordered came in a dirty, lipstick smudged glass and it took another ten minutes for a replacement to be sent out. In a hot glass. 2. We were served the wrong order entirely and had to wait for our burgers to be made again (double the wait time) 3. We weren't given any silverware or napkins upon being seated and had to ask for them, then had to wait while they were finishing in the "dryer". We had to share the one  knife we were given. 4. the food was just okay. I wasn't impressed with my blue ribbon burger. The meat wasn't seasoned well and I couldn't even tell blue cheese was on it. Also, the crispy onions were on the bottom of the sandwich and they got soggy from the drippings and sauce.  Keep in mind, the restaurant was NOT busy, so wait times and service shouldn't have been an issue. Get your act together, RR!

There's a serious leadership problem in this restaurant. The manager needs to be replaced asap. Let's begin: we waited 30 min to be seated when I counted 7 dirty open tables. We waited an hour for, by far, the worst food I have ever eaten. Everything in the table is cover in grease... everything... My plate came with greasy finger prints all over. The bathroom smells like urine... This is my first and last time I come... I can name 10 better places to eat a burger.  The only good thing was our waitress. She was friendly, and apologetic and nice. She should find a better place to work.  You can't run a successful business without leadership.
Slow service table for two enjoy a 30 minute wait even thou it's empty ! Never coming back !

Let me preface this review by saying that I've brought my family here several times and have never had a complaint.... until today.  We were starving and looking for a place to eat. We were nearby so we decided to head over. My wife called while we were on our way and was told there was no wait. We get there and there are 2 groups ahead of us, so we were told it would be a 5-10 minute wait. 30 minutes later we were taken to our table. There were 5 other groups of diners in the section that we were seated. We waited, and waited, and waited some more but no one ever came to us. We weren't given so much as a glass of water. I would've complained except that I never saw a server or manager in our section. After about 15 minutes we had had enough and got up to leave. No one acknowledged us in any way as we made our way out. I walked right in between two servers and they conversed with one another and it was as if I wasn't even there.  We ended up walking to another restaurant where we were immediately seated and served in a timely manner. Oh well, I'll chalk it up to a bad day. Fortunately I've been here before and know this isn't the norm, but it will be a while before we come back

Long wait for food (35 minutes), which was waiting at the pass for at least 15 minutes. Would have gladly helped myself, but did not want to inadvertently grab someone else's food. Finally brought to table and was cold. By then, we were starving and ate as quickly as possible. Fairly dirty bathrooms (both) without hand towels and enough soap to get through the night. Not a good representation of the the parent company. Noted that there are several other reviews with the same type of complaint of late.

this is the worst service I ever had received in Miami. Food is great, but you have to wait forever to be served, even for your order to be taken. Same experience two different days, so I'll never ever come back again.

DO NOT EAT AT THIS CHAIN I was here with two friends getting some BOCA and veggie patty burgers.  They got all the orders wrong and brought us red meat patties and the wrong toppings and wrong bun.  Not only did it take an utter hour to get the order to our table but it was all wrong!  Their excuse was miscommunication between the kitchen staff and the waitresses. I don't utterly care!  When the second order came out, one of my friends food was still wrong! Now we had spent over 2 hours there!!!!!  The manager is the worst and so was our server.  And the worst part was that they still charged us full price... Wow. Customer service here sucks. And so does the food.

Went to Red Robin the day after Christmas because a group of friends and I peaked into Samurai across the street and there was a two hour wait. We bolted to the nearest restaurant, walked in and luckily for us there were open seats at the bar.
