The place wasn't busy yet it took the bartender over 10 minutes to even acknowledge us.. we order drinks and fast forward another 20 minutes the bartender finally asks for our food orders.. we waited over half hour for our food all the while we see plates of food sitting on the counter by the kitchen. The food was cold and the onion strings in my burger were soggy when it arrived. When it came time to pay I told the bartender to charge me for my portion of the tab and I pointed out which were mine. He charged me the price of my friends burger and I didn't care, I already wanted out of there. End of story, I wish I would have waited the two hours at samurai
The chicken tender salad was huge and very  delicious definitely coming back for more I love this place and the atmosphere

The burgers are really good, although the group I went with said they have had better.  The service was ok, I am reading the reviews after the new years and I can agree the service was MEH!  They did forget my salad and the side salad was not all that.

Love this place. It's easy to get to. Right next to a great outdoor mall. The inside is pretty huge so there is not much of a wait ever for a table.  The food is good. They have a veggie burger do I am always happy. You can substitute the veggie patty for  any there signature burgers. Always tasty monastery what you get. And you can't go wrong with bottomless fries... Or broccoli of you like. Service is always nice and friendly. Can be a bit slow though. Bathrooms are always clean.  The bar area is nice. Anything you like they probably have. Come in have a burger and beer.

The only reason I'm not rating this place 5 stars is because the last few times have not been the best experiences. The burgers are great, full of flavor and moist. Appetizers are pretty good too. I love their pomegranate iced tea! Usually, I would enjoy myself there but the last three times it's been disorderly. Waiter/waitress takes their time, they chitty chat with other servers letting food sit before serving, main course makes it to the table before the appetizers. Today we asked to have our burgers sent back and done again so they wouldn't be cold by they time we finished the appetizer and the second set of burgers didn't look as appealing and the first ones, as if the cooks were upset or something. I recommend you avoid sitting by the bar in order to get a more attentive server. Sitting by the bar risks you being served by the bartender who is rightfully always busy, but your experience won't be what it should be. Great food, but I wish the service would be how it was about 3-4 months ago.

My very first visit to a Red Robin ever!  This was mid afternoon and the place was fairly empty (post-lunch hour rush). We were greeted by a very friendly hostess and seated at one of the booths. From what I could see, it's very clean and decorated with an assortment of vintage Americana on the walls.  Our server was Robyn. Very friendly and accommodating, as well as knowledgeable with regards to the menu and the company's customer loyalty/rewards program (yes, I joined and began earning points immediately!)  RR's specially is burgers, and the ability to custom build them to your liking. There are, however, other entrees available, along with a decent variety of salads and miscellaneous appetizers....VEGETARIAN options are available by the way!!! Prices range from as low as $3 for certain appetizers, to upwards of $20 for certain entrees. There is also a fair amount of beverage options (alcoholic and non) at very reasonable prices as well.  I chose the Smoke & Pepper burger, sans the bun (in an attempt to cut some calories) along with a small order of fries (which are "endless" by the way--carb addicts beware!). The burger was well done (as I requested) and very tender, seasoned without overpowering the natural flavor of the beef. The bacon wasn't as peppery as I'd expected, though. Lettuce was crisp and plentiful (in lieu of the bun's absence), and that worked perfectly for me!  Fries were fresh, not too soggy or crispy, and the made from scratch sauces provided (BBQ, ranch, spicy ketchup) all delicious!  We decided against dessert in an effort to not "overdo it" and I left with a happy tummy. I would definitely recommend this to the burger lovers out there. It's a nice break from the usual "assembly line" burgers from the established fast food joints!

First and Last !!! I was warned about the bad service. Well it was true...They have a bottom less fries which we never were not offered any additional by the server. Don't be fooled the menu looks good ordered a Southern Burger which did not look nothing near what it looked like on the Menu, the patty was greasy and full of water surely frozen. Trust me this is last on my list. I would rate a 0.

The food is good, and we went here because it's the only red robin around here. But everytime we go the service is painfully slow. The last time we went, luckily we ordered our toddlers food with the drinks. It came out quickly enough. But everything else we ordered, we just waited and waited for. Parents know how slow toddlers eat, so they should understand how perplexed we were that he was able to finish his burger, veggies and fruit and we still hadn't gotten ours. He was done and becoming impatient just sitting there, and we were filling up on drink refills, so we ended up having to get our food to go. All the other times we've been there, we haven't really been able to take advantage of the bottomless fries, because the food takes SO LONG, that you're just ready to get out of there by the time you've finished your initial helping. This place is so slow.

Great service from start to finish food was great and came out on a timely manner I'm a server so I'm super picky drinks were filled before they were empty extra napkins and we were checked on multiple times to make sure we were doing great we didn't have to ask for a thing I will deff be back again our server was top notch busy Saturday and well worth the wait to sit down and have excellent service. 10 stars from one server to another his name was Danny

NPS = 4 Maybe I should've ordered a burger. But I guess it's because I am trying to eat healthy after a long vacation that I ordered a salad with chicken breasts (sauce on the side). But ordering a burger still would not fix the service. Or maybe that's Red Robins concept?  Where they sit you and nobody comes unless it's for your initial order and to bring you the check?  I don't know. I've never been to Red Robin.  But sadly, this is my first impression of the place. The salad took 30 minutes to make.  C'mon.  It's two chicken breasts and a handful of lettuce. I don't know of any other Red Robins in South Florida but I've definitely seen commercials for them. Anyway, with this service I will be hesitant to come back.  If I even ever come back at all. It just goes to show you how good or bad customer service sways a person's experience one way or another.

I've had 2 bad experiences at this location. Both times we sat in the bar area, we've had lousy service. Messed up orders and bad wait staff make this a place that's hard to return to. Our last outing was on Saturday Feb 7th  with Guisette our server. My wifes order was messed up from the start.  I would not recommend this location to anyone let alone return here.

I used to live in North Carolina so I was familiar with Red Robin. I was excited when I saw they were putting in a Red Robin here at The Falls. I have been here with my family a handful of times and I have sadly been disappointed each time. The service is terrible at best. Expect to see lots of dirty tables and wait a long time for your drinks and food. Our kids love the food so we decided to give one more shot today. Sadly, it was the same. We passed by 6 (we counted) dirty tables on our way to our table. While we waited for our server we looked around and noticed 5 tables all waiting for drinks. We got up and left, we will not be returning here again.

This was my first visit to Red Robin. We both chose the Red Robin Gourmet Cheesburger.  The staff was welcoming and cheerful. We had to wait a bit too long to order and too long for our food. The server first took it the wrong table and when it was directed our way the fries were no longer hot and the burger was not really hot either, but I was really hungry and it tasted very good. I left most of the fries.

We have visited this location several times and have not been disappointed yet.  We started our lunch with the Boneless Wings with Blue Cheese & Chips. The small portion was perfect size for us.  This time, my son had the Smoke & Pepper burger - black-pepper bacon and extra-sharp Cheddar on a toasted ciabatta bun with house-made Smoke & Pepper ketchup.  I had the soup and sandwich combo - cup of Chili with Whiskey River Chicken Wrap. Very tasty and filling! Best deal - bottomless fries with campfire sauce!

I have been coming to this red robins location since they opened their doors. While I've always liked there burgers and ice cold beers lately the service had gone down hill. The last 3 times I have visited this place the food takes about 45 minutes to arrive. The refills never seem to show up and forget about getting an types of sauces upon your request. I can understand if your short handed or what ever the case be. Over the last 3 visits over the last 6 months it's gotten worse. They had no utensils or glass cups. They gave us plastic forks/knives and cardboard cups. Needless to say I will never be coming back to this red robins and since this seems to be the only one in Miami red robins period.

I likes me a good burger from time to time, i came here for the first time a fews days ago after i got out of the gym and i had the black and bleau burger. That shit hit the spot, i washed it down w a nice cold Stella and all was well. The server was awesome which earned her a generous tip. I will definitely be coming back.

The commercials give this place more hype than what it really deserves. The actual waitress was very helpful and attentive, but the food was wayyyyyyy off what we expected. The burger we ordered first came wrong and cold. Had to pick another burger and still that one also came wrong. If you asked for my recommendation for this place I would tell you, you rather save your money and go to McDonalds.

Service has always been top notch. Their burgers are OK, not my favorite but their bottomless fries are yummy, especially with the special seasoning! I usually prefer their bruschetta chicken sandwich. Also love getting the pretzel bites as an appetizer.

Somewhere out there is a cow that gave it's life so I would be disappointed in Red Robin.... With a name like Red Robin Gourmet Burgers, you would think that there's something special about the main act. Well, you'd be wrong. It was the most mediocre burger I've had in ages.  The atmosphere is sports bar meets Friday's, with a sprinkling of the old Bennigan's. Remember that place....? Uniformed servers with happy peppy attitudes run around with smiles on their faces while pushing burgers and appetizers on patrons. They must be on commission or something, because no matter how many times I said NO, my server kept insisting I try half a dozen things on their menu that I just wasn't in the mood for. They get an A for effort, but that's all. My order was simple, an Avocado Burger, no lettuce, with Onion RIngs and Fries. Now, I was expecting a nice fat and juicy "gourmet" burger that would wow me. Instead I received some cookie cutter patty that looks like it came out of a box from one those large wholesale frozen beef companies. You know the kind that you buy at those big box discount places when you have to feed fifty kids at a backyard pool party. The Onion Rings were good though.... If you want a good burger, there are many places around town that make hamburgers with fresh ingredients. My advice, skip this place.... That poor cow.....

Upon walking into the restaurant would noticed there were numerous tables that were quite dirty. the restaurant floor was also dirty with food and used napkins not a very appealing picture. the service was a little bit on the slow side to say the least. With the dinner menus and water very fast however our appetizer took almost half an hour to come out of the kitchen. The food itself was okay my friend ordered the burger which was tasty and I order the seafood platter which was not great but OK. It was a little bit salty for my taste. there is ample parking next to the restaurant however this place needs to improve greatly on its cleanliness has 2 bathrooms were all so dirty. I am Not sure if I would recommend this place to my friends.

Horrible service, mediocre food. I had to get my own silverware and napkins. Drinks were never refilled and forget the bottomless fries unless you can wait 30 mins for the second helping. There are much better places to spend your money.

Sat at the bar and about 5 on a Saturday. Not overly crowded. Got helped right away. Food was delicious. The garlic and herb bottomless fries were really good. As well as the burgers! Shivon(not sure of the spelling) was great and worth every penny of the tip she got. Will definitely be back!

as usual, great food. Crappy service, 15 minutes after being sat and no service. food took forever to come out and minus the kids meal which should be the easiest to prepare. Food runner walked our food around entire restaurant before realizing it was for our table.  WHY CANT THEY GET IT RIGHT WITH THE SERVICE?

Went here awhile ago. It was easily the worst tasting burger I ever had. It was poorly constructed. What was worst they sat us at a booth by the bar.... All I can say is it was the WORST service I've ever had. The waitress had an attitude plus she was unattentive. We sat around for almost an hour for our food and what was worst was that the restaurant was FREAKIN EMPTY. There was servers with nothing to do. Not coming back burger size quality and service is totally shit, not worth it

Went in for lunch with my family and was not disappointed since I had 2 hungry boys and a husband. My son and his friend ordered the bacon cheeseburgers with fries and ate it all. My husband ordered the Royal Red Robin and it was exactly as he liked with fries. He also tried the orange cream soda but he said it was just OK. A bit on the steep side at $3.99 so I would skip that in the future. DS had a banana shake and drank it dry in a minute. I try to eat healthy so I had the ensenada chicken platter and bowl of chili. The chicken was very tasty and since I shared the chili with hubby it was more than enough and very tasty. Lots of meat and not too spicy so another hit for us. The setting was nice and what you expect for a family casual dining. The server was attentive though for some reason it was a bit on warm side. But everyone enjoyed their food and no left overs so we'll defintitely be back again !
service was great .the hamburgers are   try the new donuts for dessert yummy.

Went in for lunch on a sunday.. we waited a reasonable 30 mins. Once we were seated it took a while to get help.. the waitress took our drink orders (2 drinks from the bar, 2 waters and apple juice for our son) and our food order since we had time to review. We were told the kids food would be first to come out.. food came out pretty quickly (15-20 mins) which was the same amount of time it took to get our waters.. kids food came shortly after. We were noticing that the surrounding tables were having issues and managers were constantly coming into our section. We asked our waitress for a sauce and once we got it I realized it wasn't the sauce we asked for when I mentioned this to our waitress she gave me attitude and told me that I was wrong (it was Chipotle and we asked for a sweet Asian sauce, both are really really different lol) by the time we finished our food the table was getting cleaned and another waitress at that time brings our drinks from the bar.. maybe 30-40 mins after we ordered.. idk if they were just having a bad shift, or maybe we just got the waitress on a bad day but this was our first and probably our last time at this restaurant. Other than the service the food was just ask I expected

The only thing good about this place was our server. The "gourmet" burgers aren't anything to brag about. Pink or not pink? Mine was over cooked and my gf's was raw. Onion rings were good. Fries were tasteless. They weren't busy but we were told the food would take about 90 mins to come out since the kitchen was backed up. Fortunately we got our food in like 30 mins which wasn't too bad. First and last visit.

We went to Red Robin for lunch today. We've been there several times before too, but never because we selected it. Quite frankly, we're not sure how or why this place is still in business.  We walked in and the rest of our party already was seated. They had ordered chips with some type of ranch dip as an appetizer. The dip was gross and I'm not sure why people eat that dip with tortilla chips. The chips were not fresh and had a bit too much salt. I ordered a Southwest chicken salad and my husband ordered a chicken wrap. The other people in our party also ordered salads. For some strange reason, although the restaurant was almost empty, it took 30 minutes for our food to come out. Then we had to ask our server for silverware so that we could eat.  The chicken salad had wilted pieces of lettuce in it. Aside from that, it was ok (meaning I guess I can eat it when I have to). I didn't have it with dressing, though, so I can't say whether the dressing it comes with is any good. My husband said that his chicken wrap had some strange sauce that he didn't like. We also tried some garlic fries which were brought to our table already cold and hard. We're not sure why they couldn't bring them out hot given that there was barely anyone in the restaurant. As we were leaving we noticed a bunch of people waiting for tables. That was quite puzzling, as we had a bunch of empty tables all around us, so we're not quite sure what those people were waiting for -maybe take out? Anyways, I think we might have enjoyed a Wendy's meal more than our meal at Red Robin. At least fast food restaurants are able to bring out food hot and fast. Red Robin's wilted lettuce also was a sign they may not turn over that type of food (ie, things with lettuce) frequently enough.  With poor service to boot, we both agreed we never want to go back.
Slowest service ever.  Order your food and the tab at the same time so you can get out of here the same day   Food is ok.   Better burgers at Burger King

Decided to come to Red Robin with my brother to catch a game. Drink a few beers maybe order an app, then eventually order what seems to look like delicious burgers.  Make a long story short... Spinach dip took over 20 minutes to get to us... Really? It's already preped, easily a 10 minute ticket time at most. Wasn't even that great. Bartender was weeded out of her mind with only 3 tables in the whole building. Cmon dude. Manager gave me attitude Cus I wanted a channel change to watch the game. He literally gave me the remote to find the channel because he couldn't figure it out. Get it together Red Robin!!! Or you're going out of business just like hops!

The food is always the same and great but the service is real slow its takes them close to 12 mins for the waiter to say hello. I wish the turn over at the restaurant wait staff would be less and that will probably  help.

I have been to multiple Red Robin's before but this one was by far the best one I have ever been to merely because of their excellent customer service. My friends and I were looking for a place to have a few drinks and appetizers and we stumbled upon Red Robin.  Environment: Red Robin is a chain restaurant and they all have the same look with lots of pictures of oldies/vintage American pictures and a sports-like bar in the center.  Food/Drinks: I ordered a Vanilla Porter and the clucks and fries.   And now when they say bottomless, they MEAN bottomless. I was the only one that ordered an entree and yet the waiter kept bringing us fries for the whole table of 6. Their fries are large and soft. It tastes best when sprinkled with some of Red Robin's own seasoning salt. They also have bottomless sweet potato fries for an additional price. The clucks which is actually chicken tenders which were very crispy on the outside and juicy white chicken meat in the middle. One of my friends ordered a Blue Haze which is a limited time drink which I learned from my waiter that it is for Terminator Genisys that is coming soon. The drink is made out of Cap Mo, blue curacao, pineapple juice, agave nectar, sweet and sour and lemon. It came out in a glass tiki head with a cherry and was refreshing and not too sweet.  Service: Now I wish I knew our waiter's name, but he was by far the best waiter I ever had. He gave us all a basket of fries and also was very engaging. I ordered an Angry Orchard, which is on draft later on and he unfortunately told me that their container of Angry Orchard actually exploded when they try to get me a drink so I order a Blue Moon instead. However, some miracle happened and he salvaged a Tall Angry Orchard for me and also gave me a Blue Moon (on the house) since they already poured it. This waiter really went above and beyond his job description and I had to tip  him handsomely because of it. I hope all servers at this Red Robin are similar to him. Overall, I would go again, because who doesn't love bottomless food/ drinks (their lemonade!)! Also, although I didn't have a burger during this visit, I always liked their burgers. My favorite is their famous Blue Ribbon which never disappoints if you like blue cheese.

Place is half empty. 10 minutes to be seated . seats are ripped and nasty. The tables that don't have people are piled with dirty dishes. After waiting another 10 minutes for a waitress, we placed our order and drinks...waited another 10 minutes, and got up and left as our waitress never came back... not even with our drinks. We let our waitress and the 6 other staff members who were standing around talking that we were leaving because the place was dirty and service is nonexistent, and all we got was an "ok" from one of them.

Just okay. If BJs Brewhouse has an hour wait, and you want a burger and fries then it's worth coming. I can't see any other reason. Service is adequate and varied and food quality is adequate. Nothing special here.

The burgers are decent, but they mess with you with the bottomless fries. They make you wait 10 mins+ and forget when you ordered sweet potato and take another 10 mins. Thus has happened every time I've been here.

I liked this restaurant mostly for the following reasons: 1- very kid friendly  2- great beer selection  3- great service (at least in our experience)  4- bottomless fries  Overall, the food is good (not amazing). I would say it's comparable to an upscale Steak -n- Shake. I loved the onion rings; the "cheese" fries were good but had very little cheese. I ordered a patty melt which came a little burned at first but it was replaced for me right away. It was yummy but if you don't like buttery bread don't order it.  We had a really great experience though because of our amazing server, Vanessa! She knew so much about the beers and the entrees and was out of her way nice to us. We felt like friends by the end of our meal. Definitely ask for her to have a nice experience! The restaurant is lucky to have her!
This is not my first time here, because my daughter loves burgers. They have all types of burgers and other foods. Oh, and the sandwiches come with bottomless fries!!

It's exactly what you'd expect out of Red Robin. Only 100% slower. There's no way to spend less than an hour and a half at this location, even at the bar. You think I'm kidding? Try it one day. But not on your lunch break.  It's a very frustrating place to eat.  Sometime last year, my husband got a strangely hard and rubbery piece of chicken here. I don't mean dried out overcooked. I mean I've never had food this texture before.  The manager or someone in charge came out and agreed that that was a "bad chicken" he had eaten part of. Realizing her mistake, she corrected herself and said, "I mean a MEAN chicken." Equally as reassuring.  We still laugh about that experience today and quote her often. Thnks fr th mmrs.

LOVE the burgers. Me, my husband and our daughter go there frequently. We even went for our daughters second and third birthday we enjoy it so much. But the service is lousy :( no matter what time we go. Won't stop us from going again but pleaseeee train your waitresses better or higher older people.

At least they're consistent....... Been here a few times, there is always something. From the consistently slow service to the raw chicken sandwich, always something happens. When the burgers are good they're good...... But when it's bad it is BAD!!!! Always the service is super slow, that has already come to be expected. But then the food come out wrong too. Our last experience included a mostly raw chicken sandwich & cold sweet potato fries.  We want to like this place, we really do. Like I said, when the burgers are done right they are really good. Sadly those instances are few & far between.  They've recently remodeled, but the service & food remain the same.... It's not an aesthetic makeover that try need.

My first experience here was several years ago. It wasn't a wonderful experience, but I figure it would have closed if it didn't get better.  At first we were told there was a 15 minute wait. Quick seating for a burgalicious spot. Service is funny and on point.  Food came out quick. There are countless types of burgers. They were juicy & .  We will be back & recommend.
Service was extremely slow, and the food took a while to come out. My burger came out cold and it tasted like it was loaded with salt. Would not return here.

I went there on an outing with my daughter and her friends. I thought this would be a great kid friendly place and good food. Boy was I mistaken, from the slow service to the order being brought out incorrectly. Everything that you can imagine went wrong. They desperately need better management.

Tried this place for the first time and I thought it would suck based on some of the reviews BUT .... It was AWESOME! Great food Great service !!! People need to just chill with the negative reviews - relax order a drink and talk to your friend! Lol

I'm sure you've seen the constant commercials about Red Robin and their bottomless fries.  It piqued my curiosity, but not enough to make a drive to the Pinecrest area just for a burger, but I decided that next time I find myself in The Falls mall (since the restaurant is located within the perimeter of the mall), I would give this place a try.  I saw a few of my Yelp friends checking in often, so I figured it must be decent.  Prior to Red Robin, there was a Hops restaurant (a casual dining microbrewery which apparently, abandoned ship in Florida altogether and settled in Virginia), and then the space had been empty for some time before Red Robin moved in. My opportunity to try Red Robin for the first time came a couple of weeks ago, when I took my daughter to a dinner date after we saw Zootopia together at The Falls.  The place was somewhat loud, so if you're craving a quiet or romantic dinner, this is definitely not the place for that.  It's more of a family-oriented restaurant, as they cater to kids with their videogame gadgets (more about that in a bit). The expectation is that people will bring children, so you will see quite a few as you dine in.  The ambiance and attire is extremely casual, so don't worry if you're in shorts and flip flops, most diners are too. As soon as you're seated, you will see this interesting device at your table.  As you look around, you will realize that all the tables have a device just like this one, and the device doubles as a way of getting your server's attention and paying your bill, as well as offering video games for children so they won't start to act out, due to boredom. They also have games for an older crowd, like trivia.  If you want to accept the services, you pay $1.99, which is added to your bill, and you have unlimited access to all the games on the little tablet-like device.  There is no obligation though.  It's a fun way to keep your kids entertained, and if you have a table full of kiddos, it can alleviate the stress of having to find ways of keeping them seated for an hour or longer.  My daughter likes playing on my cellphone, so this device was a welcomed alternative to having her drain my phone battery. As she happily played, I browsed the menu.  Wow, so many different alternatives! There were over 20 different types of burgers.  They also had a kid's menu which offered burgers, pasta, and other options.  Drink refills are free, which is nice.  My daughter chose the Little Red's burger, with the bottomless fries, and a strawberry lemonade to drink.  In case you're wondering what "bottomless fries" means, it means unlimited fries, as in you never feel the bottom of your plate because you're given so many.  You can get refills on the fries as many times as you'd like.  This is an interesting concept, and I wonder why Five Guys and other burger places have not copied it, because it's quite attractive, especially when you're starving and a burger only makes a small dent on your hunger.  I chose the sauteed 'shroom burger, which came with Swiss cheese as well.  Just so you know, each burger starts at about $10.  This one was one of the cheaper ones, and had mushrooms, which I love. My daughter said her burger was okay.  They bring ketchup to the table, but not mustard, which I thought was a standard condiment for burgers.  She asked why the burger didn't come with pickles, onions, or mustard.  I guess I will interpret that to mean she prefers the cheap dollar burgers from the fast food drive-thru establishments like McDonald's.  I guess she wasn't impressed.  I thought my burger was decent, though it had a good amount of mushrooms, and they were not the canned type either, which is a plus.  Was it mouth-watering or amazing? No. My mother makes better burgers on her barbecue grill, to the point you have juice running down your wrists from the seared meat because it is so juicy, thick, and smoky-flavored.  The Red Robin burger meat just isn't very flavorful, and it wasn't very juicy either, it was average, though not a flat pancake of meat as you'd get in a McDonald's burger.  I think the mushroom Swiss burger at Denny's is better, or comparable.  I did like the concept of the bottomless fries, but once I realized how busy the waitress was, it became more of a hassle and awkward to keep asking for more fries.  After ordering just one refill for my kid, I was done.   Red Robin is a safe choice for dinner and burgers, though not the most economical choice.  At the same time, it is much cheaper than neighboring Benihana, and no one can turn down a burger -- especially kids.  While it was not amazing and you probably can find better burger joints elsewhere, the convenience of having it within a mall, plus the cool videogame gadget makes it a worthy choice to consider when trying to decide where to get dinner.  I do think their burgers are less greasy and of a better quality than Johnny Rockets', for what it's worth.

I've been to this location a couple times. It is decorated quite nicely and the layout is also very accommodating. There's mostly booths to sit at which I love. However, the experience is different each time I come in.  Today we arrived and there was no hostess at the front counter to seat us. It was only a couple minutes before a woman came out to greet us and sat us at our table. She gave us a choice for seating and got us our high hair for our son. She also became our server for our dine in experience today. She got our drinks out to us quickly which were delicious and we ordered the promo they are currently offering.  Both my husband and I were able to customize our burgers to our liking which is very appealing. He got an egg on his burgers and I skipped the buns and got them wrapped in lettuce so I could avoid piling on too many calories. It's always a plus when you can customize your order. Then we had the towering doh mini order. They taste like croissant donuts and come with two sides to dip in. One chocolate and one raspberry. It was delicious!  All in all it was a pleasant experience and we will be returning!

Returned again - went to see if Red Robin improved apparently not much for some reviewers but I on the other hand had great service. Service was exceptionally fast it was a Wednesday at 5pm but there was plentiful people around. They even we're having a party in the corner of the restaurant but things were zoom zoom. I'm happy. 0/ will return again.   Ps love the remodel!
I like to try different types of burgers   this one was a surprise,  good burger,  big and juice.  The service wasn't great but ok.  Big chain food but was good   I'm coming back.

This store, located at The Falls in Miami, is the only one I've been to. I had not been here in well over a year. I signed up for their loyalty program many moons ago, and received an e-mail for a free birthday burger. I figured this would be a good time to try Red Robin again. I was pleasantly surprised that they had redesigned the entire store. The kitchen is less visible and there is a nice partition between the main dining area and the bar which is nice as the restaurant is very family-oriented and if you want to sit in an adults-only area, away from screaming babies, you can. I also like the Ziosk table management system. It is a wireless Android tablet that enables you to view the menu, play games (for a fee) and best of all, pay the check and calculate a tip with your credit card at the table, which saves a LOT of time and trouble. My birthday visit entitled me to a free gourmet burger. The offer doesn't cover their premium burgers or other entrees. I had an A-1 peppercorn burger which was "just OK". On previous visits, I have found their D.G.B. (Damn Good Burger) to be their best offering. My wife had their new "Marco Pollo" premium chicken sandwich with bacon, arugula, and tomato aioli which she really enjoyed. App of zucchini slices and jalapeño coins were good. I'd initially ordered their new app, fried "Pickle Nickles"only to be informed they'd run out. What burger restaurant runs out of pickles at 6:30?! The bottomless fries were the regular ones and they are just MEH. The host seated us quickly and cheerfully, and the server was also quick and cheerful. Other than enjoying the physical improvements to the store, I was kinda underwhelmed by my food. I probably won't be back before the next birthday...

Great burgers, beautiful setting, and overall just a pleasant place to eat. But the service did not match the quality of the food. I think I forgot how many times I was raising my hand or doing some sort of movement to grab the attention of our waitress. In all I never received a refill on my water till she brought me the check and by then I didn't want anything but to get out of there. Don't let the quality of the service reflect the food because I still really enjoyed the burger I had. I would go back to eat , but I really hope the service could be tweaked a bit .

This is my boyfriends favorite burger place and while I do enjoy the atmosphere I feel that the quality has decrease. I asked our waitress for honey mustard....I'm still waiting for it, and she refilled my water at the beginning and the end even when I kept asking for more since my burger was spicy. The burgers are good but the overall experience because of the service is what makes it a 4 star and not a 5.

This place has really tried to keep up, new decor, new art in the walls, but they still mess up.  Be prepared to be forgotten by your waiter, despite if you see the place slow.  It will never fail,  get used to never getting crispy fries, they will be saggy and cold, mind you they will come around asking if every thing "was excellent"  they will bring you fries but after you finish with your meal.  The excuse is always, "we are short of staff in the kitchen" or "I told them, but" the burgers are not what they used to be, the size and quality have changed.  Never mind giving your specifications, you will get whatever they want you to get period. Overall it is better than McDonald's or Bk, but still not worth 2 1/2 hours wasted waiting to eat bad food, and multiple  calls to remind your waiter what is missing.

I visited this restaurant on Monday evening and it was pretty empty, we were seated right away, my server was Christina she was nice and attentive. my daughter had the kids peperoni pizza for $4.99 and I had the Whiskey River BBQ for $10.69 and it was amazing! With the exception of my fries, my fries were cold but Christina didn't hesitate to change them. They also give the kids a Red balloon upon entry to the restaurant, which she loved. I liked the fact this restaurant has wide variety of items to choose from on the kids menu.

I think the burgers are really good and taste great! The service is also really attentive and tries to work with you and select things for you. I don't think the fries are that good though. They have little to no taste and need seasoning or ketchup to be swallowed. I tried the new fried pickles and I loved them. I love pickles and these were well seasoned and freshly fried.
Nothing changes, actually the service is so bad on this place.  Too bad because the burger selection is good and the sweet potatoes too. But omg the service is horrible

Terrible service!!! Took 30 minutes to bring two glasses of water and lime and an hour to bring a chicken wrap with broccoli and a wedgie burger (with cold, uncooked veggie burger) and a hand full of "cheese fries" which is basically one slice of American cheese cold and dried onto a handful of cold fries. Whenever we called our waitress Dalmi she would walk up and say "yeah, what's up". She seemed annoyed to have to talk to us and whenever we asked for something. Terrible.

Traditional chain restaurant. Always get a burger and fries which is the safest option. Normal burger better than fast food. Cheap alternative to fast food. Service is good. Diner like atmosphere. 10$ for a burger and fries. Milkshakes are good as well.

I love Red Robin, used to take the kids to the Northern Virginia (Fair Lakes and Chantilly) all the time.  Now that I moved to South Florida is a complete disappointment!  There are only two restaurants and the closest one, in the Falls is very bad.  Takes for ever to get service, charred patties, and kind of rude...the restaurant is one third full and they told me that it is taking long because they are SUPER busy....

Usually when I come here the service is great, food is always delicious and fries are great and endless and the food comes out quickly. However tonight we came into get some burgers before going to see a movie and the restaurant wasn't even half full. We waited twenty minutes to be seated and I think the hostess forgot about us. Very disappointed we left to Panera bread across the street.

Red Robbin has a pulse, it has a feel and a bit of a throwback fun to it; Red Robbin also delivered decent casual dining quality food at a reasonable price. When down in the South Miami area to visit my folks, my wife and I do love our Red Robbin. Whether with a deal in hand or just a casual night out, the experience is nice. We are typically able to walk right in and sit right down, that is, after being greeted by the friendly staff right at the door. The parking lot in self-contained and vast, and being on the outskirts of the Falls mall, there is only a little bit of possible overflow from the large mall crowds Once inside and at a table, the drink and dinner menu is presented to you while being surrounded by an eclectic style of design and a bit of Americana nostalgia. This is similar to a lot of American style causal dining, sure, but Red Robbin is, well, Red all around for the most part, and alive and vibrant with color and flair. When we typically sit in the bar outskirts booths area, service is fast and friendly and attentive, just what one might hope for. The overall food quality is great, for the vast menu they do have and an option for all palettes. The of course is also a vast drink and desert list, but make sure to save room and not order too many extra sets of the endless French fries; yes, they are bottomless and the servers have no problem bringing a re-order as soon as the original plate comes to you. Great idea to keep the side item warm and tasty. All in all, Red Robbin delivers, I have had minimal problems here and while the managers do strive to do well, little effort is needed on their part as the place sets itself alone from others

This place would be so much better if the service was better.  The waitress was half listening to us.  Also my Boca burger came out with bacon.  If someone is ordering a meatless burger, chances are they don't want any meat on it.  I guess this was lost to them.

Red Robin is a chain with a very extensive list of burgers and craft sandwiches. The service at this location is ok. They can take a while to bring drinks and you must carefully review the bill for errors, but the staff always tries to adjust when a failure happens. If you have a child, this place is the bomb diggity. Frankly, they have all their favorite foods, including milkshakes, and a tablet on which they can play on the table. We use this restaurant as a reward for good behavior with my 6yo.  Some of the burgers are great and some are just ok. I am a big fan of the Royal Red Robin and of the Whiskey River BBQ burger. My favorite side is the sweet potato fries. They are always crisp on the outside and tender on the inside. If you are going to totally blow the diet, the Cookie magic (oreo) and the Salted caramel milkshake are heavenly. Get the monster size fior $1 more and split it. Definitely enough for two!

So, I try red robin for the first time, my friend and I both ordered 2 different 'gourmet' burgers and the seafood scatter. The burger was cold- and it was tasteless. I thought at the very least they season their meat. But anyway the burger was gross - The seafood scatter, had a bad taste it, it was fried REALLY hard, gum scraping hard, and it almost tasted like garbage. I've never eaten garbage, but you know the smell of it and it was bad like that. Don't let those commercials fool you. The only think I enjoyed was my Dr. Pepper because it was strong. Other than that we both wasted $60 on some food, we gave to our room mates and they only had a smidge of a smile because they got it for free.. I didn't hear anyone say 'yuummmm'.

I'll agree with the 3 star average rating for this restaurant.  While the menu hosts a massive amount of burgers the overall quality is average.  For vegetarians any burger type can be converted by using a Boca Burger or Garden Burger patty.  I came in knowing that it's a casual restaurant but I would have liked for the vegetarian options to be more homemade and give it that uniqueness instead of using commercial patties.  Garlic fries need help here, they were a little too greasy and the taste of garlic was not shining through.  Service was friendly and consistent and overall it will not disappoint but it won't impress either.  Money wise I think you can do better as these burgers can get pricey with additions or modifications.

Came here after a movie with my 5 year old and really was just blown away by the filth and the lack of service. He really wanted to try it. Restaurant floor was disgusting. Was not offered silverware - because they ran out. And out server disappeared after telling us that "you now pay using that machine". I'm not sure how I mustered the courage to sallow the food we ordered (why, why, why?!). If the front of the house looks that bad, what does the kitchen look like? (I know, why did we stay? Why, why, why?). Anyway, don't believe me? See the attached photos. Here's hoping the deep fryer did its thing to any cooties and spared us food poisoning. I've seen much cleaner McDonald's...bathrooms.

Food was greasy.  Fries soaked in oil and so were the pretzel bits.  Service is lacking. They have 3 servers for the entire place so it takes a while to get the waitress attention.   This is my 2nd time here, now I remember why I don't come often.   Could be better.

Ok, I have to start with the fact that this location is extremely understaffed. That is the reason for the 3 stars. We walked in and the host said the wait was 20 minutes, totally cool. We went to the bar and ordered a beer. An hour later we asked the host how much longer and he had no idea who we were and that we were waiting. It took us 2 and a half hours to be seated and have food in front of us. At least the beer was cold and we didn't have to wait for it. You could tell the staff that was there were totally overwhelmed and slammed but they were SO nice. Gennesis and Candy were absolute rockstars. They were friendly apologetic and just awesome. If it weren't for them I probably would have been one of those awful people who causes a scene. Thank you to them. Unicorns of Red Robin!

Their service is horrible this is my third time going into months and every time I go I just want to get up and leave the only reason I stay is for my kids but other than that the service is horrible and they're really slow on the food!! I recommend don't even go
Burgers are the bomb!!! The bottomless  and drinks just make an entire experience great! If u can share, order just one bottomless side! We had a lot of food that we just walked away from!!! Yammy!!!

No stars for the Red Robin in Kendall by the falls.  Came again tonight and the wait is 45 minutes, once again the kitchen is backed up.  Lots of tables open, but they can't seat you as the kitchen is backed up.  People are leaving as they don't want to wait, us included.  When I asked the manager he had no explanation except that the kitchen was backed up.  Totally ridiculous, bad management.  Terrible.  They won't be in business much longer if they continue like this.

We  were there last night the place was half full Appitizers came promptly. server was good she  told us 3 times your food be out shortly. well i guess 45 minutes  is short to some. My 13.50 burger came out   Guess what yep well done ,I ordered pink. If your speciality is bugers one would think you could have a cook that knows how to cook one. The table next to us had the manager there for their complaints. Maybe if the manager got out of his office. Well you know . My son told me that place is usually like that. I guess i will stay with Fuddruckers. The have never miscooked my burger. Maybe Red Robin could get to there management  school. Ps bath rooms were disgusting over flowing trash cans paper all over floor .Can't blame the cook for that.   .

What CRAP!   I'll say it again, C R A P!    The red tavern burger was a cafeteria school type mushy meatless tasting waste. The mac & cheese was a  pile of overcooked noodles, and the biggest joke was the bottomless fries that come out in a round tin consisting of no More than five Luke warm and thin tasteless fries!  Now for the biggest shocker,  you practically have to beg to get any server  to bring you more fries even though they're not busy as they walk around they purposely avoid you so you're lucky in a half an hour if you're able to get 10 fries not worth it at all.  B I G THUMBS DOWN!!!!

After receiving numerous emails a month regarding specials and seeing advertisement around the local mall, The Falls. I decided that it's been too long (almost 5 years) and dealing with too many holiday shoppers, I figured I deserved a burger. With my mother, we figured Red Robin sounds good. I was way too hungry and tired to wait to drive to the nears Five Guys. Upon arrive, the hostess seated us quickly at the bar. Our waitress came over and introduced herself--very friendly. I did take time ordering my burger, I had to get an appetizer to hold me off. Our waitress seemed to be catering to other tables and anyone who order a head to pick up. To me it seemed like she was the only person working the bar area, when there was 7 tables--plus take out. That did not look right. After a very good while, our burgers came. My mother order the guck burger and I order the Red Robin loyal. I was starving at this point, I cut my burger in half and barely taking my first bite to find my egg undercooked. In my defense, I order the burger with the sunny side up egg. I know the yolk part is going to be runny--that's normal. However, my yolk was not the only thing undercooked. What came out of my burger in my first bite was the raw white part of the egg (the part that can make you sick). After waiting to get my waitress attention, I informed her that my egg was undercooked, some one gave me the wrong fries, and the previous server who brought the food forgot to give my mother her honey mustard. Waiting, waiting, and more waiting, my waitress even asked after what feels like 30 minutes for a hungry person (my hunger weighs more than my disgust level), she was shocked to learn that they did not bring my food out. I think you see where this goes. I had to ask my mother for a piece of her burger our of sanity. At this point, I did not want my food, I just wanted to leave. If it was not for the waitress's friendly attitude, I would have put my money on the take and walked out. When I saw my "new" burger, I tried, I honestly tried to stomach at least half the burger. I could not. I felt sick with looking at the about of mayo that the cook put on it. I'm a mayo girl, but having too thick layers of mayo would make the religious mayo eater sick.  In my honest opinion, I felt that paying $33.12 was on worth my service or the food. I did tip the waitress because again her friendly attitude and her willingness to fix the situation. When I met the manager towards the end of my meal, I just wanted to leave. I do not even know why I took left overs. They ended up in the trash can.  The only reason it received a star is because there is no "no" star option. I'm disappointed by the fact that its been almost five years since my first review and I have to update it with a completely negative of my first review. I really hope the management makes some changes to fix this place because its capable of being better.

Ordered black pepper bacon burger. It Came without bacon. I told server, she took it back, came back and told me they are cooking the bacon, then brought it back with plain bacon not black pepper bacon. I told server it's not the black pepper bacon I ordered and she took the burger to the back and brought it back a couple minutes later sprinkled with black pepper. I told other server and she said the thing is they ran out of bacon and just bought regular bacon. That's fine but they should tell customer rather than think they wouldn't notice a bacon burger without any bacon. Also my husband ordered a burger with bottomless sweet potato fries. He asked for more fries and they never came. Our server asked us twice "did the fries come yet?" But they still never did. Womp womp

I went to Red Robin for the first time yesterday. When I entered this location I noticed that over half of the restaurant was empty yet at least three parties were waiting. I thought they had finished eating and were just waiting around. To my surprise, the hostess informed me that the wait would be around 15 minutes. When I asked why? She said the kitchen was running behind. When I asked if we could sit and at any of the nearby empty tables to look at the menu and at least order drinks, she said she'd check with management. She returned and said "You cannot be seated at this time. You're going to have to wait." I was flabbergasted. I was not the only one complaining. Others seemed just as dismayed. My wife and I decided not to wait and went to a neighboring restaurant instead. The whole situation seemed ill planned and inhospitable.

Absolutely disgusting. I visited this specific Red Robin's for the first time a few months ago and ordered a simple cheese burger with a side of sweet potato fries. The burger and the fries were both cold; I could really tell they just left the plate there for a while before the waiter brought it to me.  I returned today after my friends convinced me to give it a second chance. Since I ordered a simple cheese burger last time I thought this time I'd try something different. I ordered a burger called Burning Love. This burger was advertised as being "hot" and "spicy" with fried jalapeños all over the burger. Not only was it not " hot" and "spicy"  but it yet again was cold along with the fries, and the fried jalapeños on the burger were absolutely burnt. It was like biting into ash. The whole experience made me sick to my stomach.  I'm definitely done with Red Robin's. There is absolutely no reason to go to this place when you have a Fuddruckers and Five Guys as your other options. Those places blow this place out of the water.

I really hate to have to write this review but after wanting to visit Red Robin's for months and finally going just to find a huge disappointment. The staff is very disorganized. We ordered salad, soup, a burger and fried pickles( which is what I came for). Food came out cold. The cheese turned that weird glossy color from sitting there so long. Took 25 min to get a drink because there was only one girl actually working and trying her best to keep everyone happy, her name was Vanessa. The manager came out after we complained. We left after one bite because it was cold and we didn't want to wait another 30 min for a burger. So disappointed. Manager gave us a free meal to come back, I will update later.

Needed to update because my last review was in 2014 and while it was a good review, my visits between then were mediocre at best. However, I recently visited once more and was pretty content with the entire staff. We arrived on a Friday at lunch time and the hostess quickly greeted us and took us to our table with a smile. Our server, Tony, took a while to attend to us however he kept passing by letting us know he'd be right with us. His energy was on point and he was incredibly attentive throughout our entire meal. I went with my family of 5 and everything went smoothly with our orders. The place was busy but everyone seemed to be taken care of and every staff member I saw was extremely pleasant and helpful. A woman who seemed to be the manager also came by to make sure we were doing okay. The number of crazy bad reviews is weird to me as I've never had a bad experience but it seems to be my luck. Visit and form your own opinion.
Place was packed, but food and service were impeccable. Kandi was our server and she was excellent!

Been here twice, as we just discovered it. lol We love it. Both times we had GREAT customer service. Very well explainations of their menu and recommendations. The food was amazing both times. Defintely a new favorite for us!
The ipads for ordering are nice.  But then the food is terrible.  The burgers are really bad.  Do they microwave them?  Why would a burger taste bad.

So bad Can't believe everything could be so bad Floors were greasy and slippery absolutely unsafe they were never cleaned the whole hour we were there Our order came wrong took way too long to come second order took long to come came correctly but the burger was dried out and tragic Waiters were wearing dirty clothes tables were not cleaned on time dirty dishes left everywhere

Decided to have dinner here last night, in the location across the Falls Mall. We arrived and were seated within twenty minutes, which I found it pretty long wait but no one is perfect. I ordered the usual burger for me which is the turkey burger with bottomless fries. The burgers here are one of my favorite to go places in Miami, nice and juicy with the freshest lettuce, tomato, and red onions. The fries here are the steak type and are very tasty while being light on the salt. I got to be honest the service here is a little slow and the waiters sometimes are a little cold but for a good burger I will go anywhere.
They ALWAYS overcook my burger. I've been times before and had good experiences but lately it's been sub-par :( Sad because I love burgers.

I have been a Red Robin customer for nearly 10 years and sadly have to say that the food in this particular location was Terrible!  I am a huge fan of the Royal Robin burger (the one with the egg on top), well they burned the egg, the lettuce was missing and the fries were old and cold. The 2 stars was for the effort of the waiter, who wasn't being supported by the kitchen crew.  The restaurant was relatively empty (because it was a Wednesday), but yet we had to wait like 30 minutes for our food.  So yep..., really disappointed! :(

Upon arrival on a lazy Sunday we waited at the hostess station for several minutes before even being acknowledged (bad sign)  We were seated and our waiter (Tony) was super energetic & knowledgeable that we commented to each other that hopefully this trip here would be a success (as past visits have seen poor service, long waits and messed up orders)  Our food came out fast and was prepared to order (good sign) but then the problems began - my husbands burger had the wrapper from the cheese still on it (disgusting)!!! When we complained to Tony he was quick to ask if he wanted another one (which he did not) and also offered excuses and tried to appease us as much as possible - he brought us more fries and said the burger was on the house.  He made things ok and I'm glad he was our waiter - just very disappointed that the manager NEVER came by to apologize- guess it will be another few years before we try it again!

In this case, 3rd time was not the charm. It's been at least a year between the 2nd and 3rd visit.  We had such horrible service on our 2nd visit,  we swore we wouldn't be back. Fast forward to today,  3/25/17, and yep.... CRAPPY service AGAIN. The hostess sat us at a booth by the bar. After a bit of a wait, the bartender/server finally came and took our drink order and we requested the bottomless fries.. A different server brought my tea and hubby didn't get water. 10 minutes later, I got up and had to ask for his water. Still no fries,  so, I asked the hostess to get them. Finally!.....now, we're just waiting on our food.  And a different server brought it out about 45 min later. Hubby's burger was barely warm. Our server asked in passing  (didn't ever stop) if it was to our liking. Seriously?.... We are adamant this time...  we will NEVER go back.  Not when Fuddruckers is just blocks away.

Not really gourmet, but fresh and yummy! The service is always good... we come often due to my kids class ending late and being nearby. Despite having other nearby choices, this is a place we've coke to trust. Family friendly both ok ambience and menu variety. The food always tastes fresh, comes out promptly and warm. Lots of healthier alternatives if you're not into the burgers...and if you are, there are still options.  Lots of drink choices, alcoholic and non!

My son's comment "this burger smells like a McDonald's burger" sums up what used to be a quality burger experience to a cheap unsatisfactory experience.  The patty was think, over cooked, and without taste. The service was HORRIBLE. Our order took 30 min before we were served and another 20 minutes before our waitress came by to see if everything was "ok?"  No refills for our drinks, no bottomless fries, no correction to our order despite pointing it out, and no apologies for the horrible service.  If they had 50% of tables full it would be a stretch to say they were busy. Sadly, they were closer to 30% capacity. No excuse.

Good burgers, but wait time can be a tad long. On one particular visit about two years ago, I asked our waiter to change the channel from some boring sport like golf to a football game. He returned about 15 minutes later, saying the manager had refused to change it, so our waiter went ahead and did it for me. I don't know why the manager refused when no one in the restaurant cared for what was being shown and my request was reasonable.

Well cooked juicy burgers and great service.  Our server Will was noticeably attentive, friendly, and more than once saw an issue coming and took measures to fix them before I even noticed the potential issue.  He had multiple tables, but didn't miss a beat with ours. My only issue: Their "Monster" milkshake size is not very large (not even by European standards).  They should either serve enough to justify the term "monster" or find a less deceptively exaggerating description for it.  Perhaps involving fluid oz.

This was my first visit and I was very pleased with both the service and menu. Everything on the menu sounded great and my wrap was delicious. Plenty of healthy choices and just as many guilty pleasures. Unfortunately, almost all dishes (other than desserts) are covered in some sort of seasoning: salads, burgers fries...everything! And that junk gives me horrible migraines. Haven't been able to eat there since I made that discovery. If you haven't noticed constant headaches after your visit, enjoy the food.

A place for 290 people will hardly be considered a Gourmet Burguer restaurant. It is a just a regular burguer store with slow service, not very clean, average food. House was almost empty and it took them more than 30 minutes to prepare 2 burguer dishes.

Great place! Have never been let down. Always an enjoyable experience. I have dined in several times here as well as just sit at the bar for a few drinks. All the wait staff is courteous and this restaurant is always clean.  Today I came with my family and we ordered the kids burger, mad love burger and the southern charm burger. All cooked perfectly and very flavorful.  I would like to shed some light on our server , we had him twice before and he is always nice and attentive to his table. Anything we wanted or needed he brought it to us quickly. His name is Andre and he was very knowledgeable on the menu helping us make the right choice on what to order! Thank you Andre it was again a pleasure having you serve us! We hope to have you next time we come back!  If in the falls area and in the mood for a great burger and bottomless fries come to Red Robbin! You we'll be satisfied, trust me. ! And if you remember ask for ANDRE! He'll take care of you.

Visited with my family late tonight  We came in late because we were on our way back from being away. My son has food allergies and we told the manager. he went in the kitchen and made sure the food we ordered was made correctly. Our server was very nice and we had a good time. Food was delicious. Thank you
This place or dump doesn't serve people right and I find it very rude to not serve your customers right. 1 star here.

I am a server and I understand certain things that other customers may not, however the service at this place was horrible.. first off it took the server about 5 minutes to intially come to the table and ask us for our drink order. We got mozzarella sticks as an appetizer and the first time they came out cold and the cheese was not melted.. we sent them back and the second time around nothing changed still horrible. Now I don't blame the sever for that because she doesn't cook the food, but she didn't seem to care. The salad I ordered was fine my boyfriend got clucks and fries, also fine. With his order he gets unlimited French fries, and every time he asked for more fries it took over 5 minutes to get to the table, we also sat there with empty drinks for a while. At this point a manger should have stopped by the table to apologize but that didn't happen. Don't think I will be coming to this place ever again.

Unfortunately I had such a bad experience.  The waitress we had truly was bad.  I'm pretty lenient with servers because the job is not easy and it's hard at places like these where you get a lot of children.  Today we sat down and never rcvd silverware or napkins.  I had to ask for them.  We rcvd our food quickly so no complaints on that.  Kids got mac'n'cheese and I ordered a bacon burger with fries and a blue moon.  I asked her if she had any specials and she said till 6 and asked me if I knew the time.  I'm like no I don't have a watch or phone on me if she could check. Just silly not to know for customers.   Then one of my daughters got sick and threw up after she ate.  I'm not blaming the food because it could have been a number of things.  Thank goodness I had plates around and some napkins.  Waitress came back and I said that I apologized as my daughter had thrown up and I cleaned as much as I could.  If she could bring more napkins.  As I'm still cleaning and organizing so she doesn't have to deal with much throw up she never comes back with napkins.  Then she starts to clean the table next to mine and I'm asking very upset where are my napkins and she's like oh I forgot. In addition instead of helping to pick up the plates she left them there with vomit all over them.  I finally organized them in top of each other so she could easily clean up and pick up plates vs vomit.  I didn't get to eat my food b/c of the chaos and I ask for a take home.  She brings me a small container and I advise that it's not big enough to take my full meal.  She did offer to bring a sprite or something for my daughter so I appreciate that but overall the experience was difficult.  Plus I was there with my other twin so many could just take off to the bathroom with one child.  She never wiped down the table, offered more napkins and I had to tell her to please remove the plates.  I spoke to the manager before I left to advise my complaints, he seemed to understand but don't think he cared.  He didn't ask where I sat or who was my waitress, I could be that the waitress advised what happened or he just wanted me to go away.  If the waitress did tell him, why didn't he come to the table to check or why didn't he train the waitress how to deal with the matter.  To top it off I got home and finally relaxed to eat my dinner and the burger was not the bacon burger I asked for :-/.
We came into Red Robin driven in my the continous commercial. My daughter and nieces loved the burgers but the service left much to be desired. The staff would disappear and the service was slow.

I haven't been here since it first open and when it opened for a while the service was great. I came in super excited to taste again the Prime Chophouse. Once we sat down we noticed the wait was so long was because they were understaffed. Our waiter was a sweet girl but her manager at one point snatched a drink from her hand to give it to another table. Poor girl was so embarrassed and I can clearly see that the lack of professional management was horrible. Hopefully it gets better cause I love the burgers

Ok, I'm going to give you some advice: 1: They took my order the WRONG WAY. I asked for NO MAYO and Tomato on my BBQ chicken and what did I got the opposite, lesson 1 always review with your waiter/waitress. 2: The entire place like my brother said is run by "Teenagers" that's right 18-23 year olds who don't know what their doing. Lesson 2 tell your son or daughter to work somewhere else besides this place. 3: I'm kinda running out of words so... I hope you don't take this place too "good" cause it's not.

Terrible! We waited 30 min to get seated and when we finally did the tables were half empty!!! There was 10 families ahead of us waiting for nothing! We could have all sat down and eaten right away if the restaurant was appropriately staffed. We walked by so many dirty tables it was not appetizing. Then another 10 min wait for our server to come greet the table and 30 more minutes for our food! Which was mediocre at best! All this on a Friday night?!? Get with it management!
Worst place ever!!! Service is slow, food is served cold. Manager never came to the table.

I've been here several times but the last few times, the wait for food has been long as well as service being slow. I loved my chicken sandwich I got but I asked to sub my fries with onion rings, and the onion rings were still not fully cooked. When I bit into an onion ring, a bunch of powder came out, as if there was still flour from the batter inside. First time that happened to me. However, even though it took a while, the Irish beer shake I asked for was very tasty! Overall, I think this location needs some improvement and it's not the kind of place you go to if wanting a quick bite.

First time eating there ,prob our last. Our waiter was rude and abrupt like we were putting him out eating there. Didn't ask if wanted anything besides the burger,  or what type of cheese on our burgers . Husband ordered a bacon cheeseburger,.  we"'re waiting for over 35 min the waiter doesn't come by and say anything , I'm watching orders go out of the kitchen, finally he brings out our burgers and tells my husband they ran out of bacon and had to go to the grocery store across the street and they're cooking it now! We told them to forget the bacon ,  the whole point was a bacon cheeseburger not a cheeseburger with bacon on the side!!! Both of our fries were cold from sitting , do not recommend
Beware,  the entertainment tablet on the table is Not free! However, didn't find out until I got the bill. And the food is not good. Overpriced for taste.

Was disappointed with the burgers specials for $6.99. Only three to choose from and in my opinion too much cheese on the one I ordered.  The floats were very tasty and large. You can also get as many refills as you want or can actually drink which in my case one was enough.  Sad to say that I wasn't crazy about the food or the service.

The burgers are good. I usually get the wedgie burger, which is wrapped in lettuce rather than on a bun. I do prefer medium rare but they only offer medium or well done.  One huge complaint is that I'm disappointed in the poutine. After living in Montreal and eating true poutine, as well as making it myself, I was surprised to see the cheese curds were fried. This defeats the whole purpose of poutine! The cheese is supposed to melt from the hot french fries and brown gravy. I can't for the life of me figure out why they would change the original recipe. I hope they fix it!!!

This place gets 2 stars only because I enjoyed the flavor of my burger. However the service? Holy crap. I am not one to complain about little things and I even let certain bigs things slide. Tonight, my order was never put in. I informed the person who brought everyone else's food because our server was nowhere to be found. It then took 15 minutes for someone to even acknowledge it and tell me they had put order in and it would be right out. We were never offered more fries for our "bottomless" fry orders. A dessert was brought with no utensils. We asked for a spoon and 10 minutes later had to walk over to kitchen and request it again. We asked for a to-go box that came 20 minutes later. They have these tablets at the table where I assumed I could pay because we weren't offered our check. Then when using the tablet the server comes around and says that we shouldn't use the tablet because it doesn't split the checks correctly(I guess I was supposed to magically know that.) someone at our table orders a refill it's brought to the wrong person. Seriously the list goes on. This place was 80% empty and I mention that because if you're swamped and the place is packed, I get it, servers work their assets off. But this was the last time I go to Red Robin. Shame because I really like their burgers.

Came for dinner at 8pm on a tuesday night with my family. The service was great, but the food was mediocre. The fries were cold, my margarita was not filled to the brim, the toast that came with my clam chowder was stale. My first time, and probably my last time-too many other options to settle.
Great burger fast service and endless streak frys. They have a mud slide that is amazing must try.

I love coming to Red Robin when I'm craving a burger. Why you ask? Because the service is always good quick and they have a large selection of tasty burgers.  When you come in normally there is a server greeting you at the front.  This one time I came I was waiting for the rest of my party so I decided to sit at the bar.  There was NO ONE at the bar.  Literally no one.  The bartender was there and he appeared to be cleaning and whatnot.  Completely ignored me.  Like I wasn't even there.  I tried making eye contact and waving him down.  nothing.  wow.  I sat there for about ten minutes when I realized this guy was not going to take my order.  So I stood up and luckily my party arrived.  I was quickly seated and thank god the experience got better after that. My family and I were sat down and the server came immediately (Andre but he said we could call him AJ). He quickly asked us for our order and made some recommendations.  Thanks to him I had one of the best burgers ever!  They also had what seemed to be an infinite amount of fries.  Thanks to AJ the experience improved tremendously.  If it weren't for him this place would of gotten a 2 just because of the service. The burgers are always good here.  I have been here a few times and their specialty burgers are amazing.  I always love trying different combination of flavors for burgers.

Im surprised at how much Red Robin has improved. They have entirely revamped their menu to offer a great selection of burgers and sandwiches. Their manager is very sweet and attentive, as well as the waiting staff. They have endless fries with your order which you can swap for endless salad if you want. I am so happy I decided to give this restaurant another shot!  Great place!

Love this Red Robin location! It's in a perfectly central place, and right in the Falls Mall shopping center. We've been here a few times already and it's never disappointed. We always receive a smile and friendly and attentive customer service from every team member we encounter.  Their burgers are delish, as well as the onion ring tower appetizer, and of course, their milkshakes! I've had the Oreo one a couple of times and it's always very creamy and delish. Everything is served hot and fairly timed.  Will be back soon!

Our table was forgotten after the order was placed. The waitress totally disappeared and the bartender had to attend us. Later our waitress showed up at the table next to us , but never came to ours. So the bartender didnt come either since its not his job.  We were left totally unattended. 20 minutes later our food is delivered by the kitchen personnel. My burger had rotted avocado slices. If i dont remove the bun to put ketchup i would have never caught the rotted avicado and it would end up eating it. Thank goodness i saw it. I called the bartender over for him to please address it to the Manager whom didnt seem to have any concern about it. So i requested new gresh cut avocado and that was brought by another employee. After I affixed the ingredients myself, In the end I didnt eat all of it.  The burger meat was cold and hard! Overcooked! Terrible Service! Terrible food! And no Concerns for the customer! Like most businesses,  They start really cool then the responsible Company Asset allows it to rot down! If youre gonna take a job, make sure you get it done right  That goes for all positions. If not, let someone else who is willing to do it right have it. * What good is the menu if you cant provide the right service. *

This place always has poor service every time I walk  in here. Very poor management. The only I come here is because it's convenient when at the Falls and the food is good.  10 minutes still no server....ugh.
